commit_message:
Use native Zuul v3 tox job

Replace tox-genconfig legacy job with native Zuul v3 job.

Also, remove name from project stanza, this is not needed anymore.

Change-Id: Ic79f5a018faab4d0de6296808dd5e8621ea9d498

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-13 06:09:24.000000000', 'message': 'Adding playbooks for overcloud backup and restore

These are playbooks designed to backup and restore an overcloud.
Currently they only support an RPM-based overcloud (e.g. ocata,
newton, etc) but work is being done to accommodate containerized
overclouds.

The backup playbook is pretty straightforward. You run the playbook
and it'll create a backup of the databases (MySQL, MongoDB, and Redis)
and then create a backup of each Controller file system. Probably the
only pre-req is that the undercloud needs SSH access to itself to
perform certain Ansible tasks on itself.

When running the restore playbook, you need to set the
overcloud_backup_tar variable to the location of the backup tar. For
example:

$ ansible-playbook -i inventory \
--ssh-common-args="-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" \
-e "overcloud_backup_tar=overcloud-backup-20180711T121449.tar" \
~/overcloud-backup/overcloud-restore.yaml

This playbook will restore the MySQL database only. Further restore
functions will be added in the future.

Also work noting that both playbooks should work with
tripleo-ansible-inventory script and static inventories that follow
the same basic structure. For example:

[undercloud]
192.0.2.1

[Controller]
192.0.2.100
192.0.2.101
192.0.2.102

Change-Id: Ia43b4a4c2412b31b9e947f9ab3fc21fbcf2c1ca8
'}]
commit_message:
Adding playbooks for overcloud backup and restore

These are playbooks designed to backup and restore an overcloud.
Currently they only support an RPM-based overcloud (e.g. ocata,
newton, etc) but work is being done to accommodate containerized
overclouds.

The backup playbook is pretty straightforward. You run the playbook
and it'll create a backup of the databases (MySQL, MongoDB, and Redis)
and then create a backup of each Controller file system. Probably the
only pre-req is that the undercloud needs SSH access to itself to
perform certain Ansible tasks on itself.

When running the restore playbook, you need to set the
overcloud_backup_tar variable to the location of the backup tar. For
example:

$ ansible-playbook -i inventory \
--ssh-common-args="-o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" \
-e "overcloud_backup_tar=overcloud-backup-20180711T121449.tar" \
~/overcloud-backup/overcloud-restore.yaml

This playbook will restore the MySQL database only. Further restore
functions will be added in the future.

Also work noting that both playbooks should work with
tripleo-ansible-inventory script and static inventories that follow
the same basic structure. For example:

[undercloud]
192.0.2.1

[Controller]
192.0.2.100
192.0.2.101
192.0.2.102

Change-Id: Ia43b4a4c2412b31b9e947f9ab3fc21fbcf2c1ca8

openSUSE ships a HAProxy profile which prevents the creation of the

profile="/usr/sbin/haproxy" name="/run/haproxy.stat.21697.tmp" pid=21697 comm="haproxy" requested_mask="c" denied_mask="c" fsuid=0 ouid=0

As such, lets follow the common pattern across OSA roles to disable the
profile instead of trying to manage it.

(cherry picked from commit 31f0c0a929da3032b7d1eddc79e78fbabfd845a4)

commit_message:
Disable HAProxy apparmor profile if present

openSUSE ships a HAProxy profile which prevents the creation of the
/run/haproxy.stat file.

profile="/usr/sbin/haproxy" name="/run/haproxy.stat.21697.tmp" pid=21697 comm="haproxy" requested_mask="c" denied_mask="c" fsuid=0 ouid=0

As such, lets follow the common pattern across OSA roles to disable the
profile instead of trying to manage it.

Change-Id: Iaacb628f4cc78687c95034e81ed924807a3018bd
(cherry picked from commit 31f0c0a929da3032b7d1eddc79e78fbabfd845a4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 17:38:39.000000000', 'message': "Set SSH server keep alive options

When os-net-config configures the network configuration on the overcloud nodes
ssh connections can be dropped.

Since we have ssh retries set to 8 in ansible.cfg, ansible would retry the task
since it was failed by a ssh connection error.

However, the first task was actually still running and it eventually succeeds.

The second task that was kicked off by ansible as a retry, sees that the
deployment is already applied, but the notification file (*.notify.json) does
not yet exist since the first task is still in progress. This causes the second
task to fail with the error reported in the bug and the whole ansible-playbook
run to then fail.

Setting ServerAliveInterval and ServerAliveCountMax ssh options seems to fix
the issue as ssh doesn't drop the first connection when these are configured.

Change-Id: I08781fe2aa6472d3fae5c5f5d0babd1f7a3b9b2d
Closes-Bug: #1792343
"}, {'created': '2018-09-21 08:02:06.000000000', 'message': "Set SSH server keep alive options

When os-net-config configures the network configuration on the overcloud nodes
ssh connections can be dropped.

Since we have ssh retries set to 8 in ansible.cfg, ansible would retry the task
since it was failed by a ssh connection error.

However, the first task was actually still running and it eventually succeeds.

The second task that was kicked off by ansible as a retry, sees that the
deployment is already applied, but the notification file (*.notify.json) does
not yet exist since the first task is still in progress. This causes the second
task to fail with the error reported in the bug and the whole ansible-playbook
run to then fail.

Setting ServerAliveInterval and ServerAliveCountMax ssh options seems to fix
the issue as ssh doesn't drop the first connection when these are configured.

Change-Id: I08781fe2aa6472d3fae5c5f5d0babd1f7a3b9b2d
Closes-Bug: #1792343
"}]
commit_message:
Set SSH server keep alive options

When os-net-config configures the network configuration on the overcloud nodes
ssh connections can be dropped.

Since we have ssh retries set to 8 in ansible.cfg, ansible would retry the task
since it was failed by a ssh connection error.

However, the first task was actually still running and it eventually succeeds.

The second task that was kicked off by ansible as a retry, sees that the
deployment is already applied, but the notification file (*.notify.json) does
not yet exist since the first task is still in progress. This causes the second
task to fail with the error reported in the bug and the whole ansible-playbook
run to then fail.

Setting ServerAliveInterval and ServerAliveCountMax ssh options seems to fix
the issue as ssh doesn't drop the first connection when these are configured.

Change-Id: I08781fe2aa6472d3fae5c5f5d0babd1f7a3b9b2d
Closes-Bug: #1792343

subject: tasks: apparmor: Disable the HAproxy profile on all hosts.
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-21 16:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2018-09-21 16:48:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-09-21 17:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-21 16:45:25.000000000', 'message': 'tasks: apparmor: Disable the HAproxy profile on all hosts.

This mimics https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603078/. We need to disable
the HAproxy profile on all hosts which spawn up containers since it's
possible for a container to use HAproxy for the OpenStack services that it
contains but if the host is not properly configured to allow HAproxy to
operate freely then the container operation will be broken. For example,
here is a log from a neutron container which tries to use haproxy for
the metadata service but it breaks because the host apparmor prevents
Haproxy from working properly

 Running command: ['sudo', '/usr/bin/neutron-rootwrap',
 '/etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf', 'ip', 'netns', 'exec',
 'qrouter-e24204c6-698c-44e5-8dfb-dd13dbd734ed', 'haproxy', '-f',
 '/var/lib/neutron/ns-metadata-proxy/e24204c6-698c-44e5-8dfb-dd13dbd734ed.conf']
[...]
 ERROR neutron.agent.linux.utils [-] Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: ;
Stderr: [ALERT] 263/181939 (11200) : Cannot open configuration
file/directory
/var/lib/neutron/ns-metadata-proxy/e24204c6-698c-44e5-8dfb-dd13dbd734ed.conf
: Permission denied

and on the host (which did not run the haproxy_server role) we see

audit: type=1400 audit(1537547548.513:131): apparmor="DENIED"
operation="getattr" info="Failed name lookup - disconnected path
error=-13 profile="/usr/sbin/haproxy" name="dev/pts/5" pid=29842
comm="haproxy" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=0 ouid=0

Change-Id: I40bb76ef1e32b5a50345f9c1159667608066870b
'}]
commit_message:
tasks: apparmor: Disable the HAproxy profile on all hosts.

This mimics https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603078/. We need to disable
the HAproxy profile on all hosts which spawn up containers since it's
possible for a container to use HAproxy for the OpenStack services that it
contains but if the host is not properly configured to allow HAproxy to
operate freely then the container operation will be broken. For example,
here is a log from a neutron container which tries to use haproxy for
the metadata service but it breaks because the host apparmor prevents
Haproxy from working properly

 Running command: ['sudo', '/usr/bin/neutron-rootwrap',
 '/etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf', 'ip', 'netns', 'exec',
 'qrouter-e24204c6-698c-44e5-8dfb-dd13dbd734ed', 'haproxy', '-f',
 '/var/lib/neutron/ns-metadata-proxy/e24204c6-698c-44e5-8dfb-dd13dbd734ed.conf']
[...]
 ERROR neutron.agent.linux.utils [-] Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: ;
Stderr: [ALERT] 263/181939 (11200) : Cannot open configuration
file/directory
/var/lib/neutron/ns-metadata-proxy/e24204c6-698c-44e5-8dfb-dd13dbd734ed.conf
: Permission denied

and on the host (which did not run the haproxy_server role) we see

audit: type=1400 audit(1537547548.513:131): apparmor="DENIED"
operation="getattr" info="Failed name lookup - disconnected path
error=-13 profile="/usr/sbin/haproxy" name="dev/pts/5" pid=29842
comm="haproxy" requested_mask="r" denied_mask="r" fsuid=0 ouid=0

Change-Id: I40bb76ef1e32b5a50345f9c1159667608066870b

[{'created': '2018-09-19 09:11:40.000000000', 'message': 'Downgrade ipxe-qemu during grenade job

Temporary workaround while we find the problem with the
newer ipxe-qemu package.

Story: #2003808

commit_message:
Fix grenade tests

Downgrade ipxe-qemu during grenade job
Temporary workaround while we find the problem with the
newer ipxe-qemu package.
Task: #26553

Switch grenade job to wsgi
Now that grenade is using Rocky as its base we
can switch to WSGI for ir-api. Also now required
for CI as IRONIC_USE_WSGI was getting flipflopped
from False -> True -> False during the grenade job.
Task: #26594

Disable the ironic-api redirect as it doesn't work with wsgi
Task: #26595

Increase the keystone token timeout, for grenade jobs only
Task: #26596

Story: #2003808
Change-Id: Icc380e6e5128f15f90b3a86cb773e7bb8d60d076
Depends-On: Ib7d68d1360e3cdbfdc2ff185a9760461e75ac8c4

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I61d023933f68af03ce61146a49b5ec305820e920
(cherry picked from commit 272e8c3d49ddc6e4069ef5da3ff2b085e598638d)

commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ieb2bedd3a6ebd005f224a26010066c8d6f7928ef
(cherry picked from commit 7ed303cd6b8f61e478d78c0089df77ce4ad6ef43)

commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ieb2bedd3a6ebd005f224a26010066c8d6f7928ef
(cherry picked from commit 7ed303cd6b8f61e478d78c0089df77ce4ad6ef43)

commit_message:
Fix upper-constraints link in tox file

In some environments, if the upper-constraints file is not joined to the
"-c" option in tox, an error is raised when executing tox.

Change-Id: I715fe6dd91d3b860212b2368fdb2b9f610926908
Closes-Bug: #1793562

commit_message:
Use swiftUrl as a base for exported plan download URL

This changes the way the exported plan and logs download URL is generated.
The temporary url is parsed, path is stripped from API version
and AUTH parts and appended with search section to swiftUrl.

This ensures that generated URL is always accessible since it is based
on swiftUrl.

Story: 2001869
Task: 14323

Change-Id: I3961eba69cb910e0fb63ca763f301bfc4ba7c05c
(cherry picked from commit 814122fd998c2e1b7a83e257e3efe71cad5c5ddf)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 15:56:56.000000000', 'message': 'Add tempest-slow job to run the tempest slow tests

By default, tempest-full jobs don't run the "slow" tests
which test useful things like encrypted volumes, swap
volume, etc. The slow tests aren't part of the default
tempest run since they can be, well, slow.

Tempest has tempest-slow job now which run all the slow
tagged tests.[1]

Detailed discussion on ML[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n146
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

Conflicts:
      .zuul.yaml

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I51adbbdf13711e463b4d25c2ffd4a3123cd65675 nor change
I24a5f73c29094a23e2fdef8ee8b43601300af593 in Pike.

Related-Bug: #1783405

Change-Id: I5cb829beebcc59de682cba927f5b01793ec70d00
(cherry picked from commit f6390f71ff96a1ea6f4315253ef61e0a0c2ef980)
(cherry picked from commit 105dbbcbf2b500b11de7a5708742de5d92edc60e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add tempest-slow job to run the tempest slow tests

By default, tempest-full jobs don't run the "slow" tests
which test useful things like encrypted volumes, swap
volume, etc. The slow tests aren't part of the default
tempest run since they can be, well, slow.

Tempest has tempest-slow job now which run all the slow
tagged tests.[1]

Detailed discussion on ML[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n146
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

Conflicts:
      .zuul.yaml

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I51adbbdf13711e463b4d25c2ffd4a3123cd65675 nor change
I24a5f73c29094a23e2fdef8ee8b43601300af593 in Pike.

Related-Bug: #1783405

Change-Id: I5cb829beebcc59de682cba927f5b01793ec70d00
(cherry picked from commit f6390f71ff96a1ea6f4315253ef61e0a0c2ef980)
(cherry picked from commit 105dbbcbf2b500b11de7a5708742de5d92edc60e)

Rally scenario CinderVolumes.create_volume_from_snapshot creates volume from snapshot,
but it deletes the snapshot before the volume.
The correct order should be deleting volume before the source snapshot,

Closes bug #1718280

commit_message:
Correct snapshot ordering

Rally scenario CinderVolumes.create_volume_from_snapshot creates volume from snapshot,
but it deletes the snapshot before the volume.
The correct order should be deleting volume before the source snapshot,

Closes bug #1718280

Change-Id: I1bf7e21d92a501409552a2e83d229d082c31c9c5
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

(2 comments)

I have been debugging this patchset by running neutron.tests.unit.plugins.ml2.test_port_binding.PortBindingTestCase.test_binding_no_filter

By making the changes I describe in-line, I was able to move forward in the execution of a port binding from here (due to the exception triggered here https://review.openstack.org/#/c/382037/10/neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py@797):

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L363

to here:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L373

When executing _commit_port_binding, we get the following exception in line https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L524: http://paste.openstack.org/show/585246/

Look at line https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py#L510. bind_context._binding_levels is assigned to cur_context._binding_levels. Right before line 509 (where db.set_binding_levels is called) bind_context._binding_levels contains: 

bind_context._binding_levels [PortBindingLevel(driver='test',host='host-ovs-no_filter',level=0,port_id=55e95e07-93ca-4b8e-9ea0-1204e14e216c,segment=NetworkSegment(630d16ef-ab0a-45f8-9b7d-d5479cf41168))]

Right after this line, bind_context._binding_levels contains:

bind_context._binding_levels [PortBindingLevel(driver='test',host='host-ovs-no_filter',level=0,port_id=55e95e07-93ca-4b8e-9ea0-1204e14e216c,segment=None)]

As you can see, segment is now None. Something happens when the binding levels are written to the DB. I suggest you explore what is going on there."}, {'account_id': 22774, 'date': '2016-10-11 15:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 22774, 'date': '2016-10-11 16:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

This is actually a big improvement. The ML2 unit tests are now passing: http://paste.openstack.org/show/585667/.

Right now, the patchset is only failing 3 unit tests. Two of those are:

neutron.tests.unit.objects.test_ports.PortDbObjectTestCase.test_get_object_with_synthetic_fields

neutron.tests.unit.objects.test_ports.PortDbObjectTestCase.test_get_objects_with_synthetic_fields

In both cases, a foreign key constraint is being violated: 

FOREIGN KEY constraint failed [SQL: u'INSERT INTO ml2_port_binding_levels (port_id, host, level, driver, segment_id) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?)'] [parameters: ('0a3750b8-52e3-454d-9ff4-5ba99bdd0ef7', u'slbovequcp', 730, u'vlowbpdhoy', 'fe5da01b-f701-4020-9b34-d14f33634e78')]

I don't have more time tonight to take a look at this further. But I wanted to leave this comment"}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2016-10-14 05:49:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

The third failure is here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py#L80. So I think you have to bump the version of the PortBindingLevel object and then update the hash here: https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py#L43.

As for the Foreign key constraint failures mentioned in my previous comment, my guess is that they have to do with the setup of the test.'}, {'account_id': 22774, 'date': '2016-10-14 18:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-14 20:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Verified-1

I am running the following test with PS16:

$ ./run_tests.sh -d neutron.tests.unit.objects.test_ports.PortDbObjectTestCase.test_get_object_with_synthetic_fields

Before triggering the test, I added the following two lines:

import pdb
pdb.set_trace()

right after this line:

https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/objects/base.py#L560

Here's the log of my debugging session:

http://paste.openstack.org/show/585746/.

As you can see, the test setup creates the following objects in the DB:

<class 'neutron.db.models_v2.Network'>
<class 'neutron.db.models_v2.Subnet'>
<class 'neutron.db.models_v2.Port'>
<class 'neutron.db.models.allowed_address_pair.AllowedAddressPair'>
<class 'neutron.plugins.ml2.models.PortBinding'>

And then it comes time to create <class 'neutron.plugins.ml2.models.PortBindingLevel'>. The PortBindingLevel object to be created is the following:

{'driver': u'jkyckxpfqk', 'host': u'rkowvuunen', 'segment_id': '35b159cb-6e30-4228-b395-985fbcc697b3', 'port_id': ''5c0ce471-bbf1-451d-98b5-f82d7bc748c6'', 'level': 854}

Right before let the code attempt the PortBindingLevel object creation in the DB, I make sure port_id '5c0ce471-bbf1-451d-98b5-f82d7bc748c6' exists. It indeed does:

(Pdb) self.obj_context.session.query(models_v2.Port).all()
[<neutron.db.models_v2.Port[object at 7f6e59ca4a50] {project_id=u'fqenelxsoe', id=u'5c0ce471-bbf1-451d-98b5-f82d7bc748c6', name=u'uawuebqspo', network_id=u'77dcef9a-0797-451b-943e-e5fc9be670b8', mac_address=u'FE-16-3E-0C-F9-1C', admin_state_up=False, status=u'cdfqmbmgiw', device_id=u'rtegeeykmq', device_owner=u'qlgpfniljc', ip_allocation=None, standard_attr_id=3}>]

I also check that the NetworkSegment object with id 35b159cb-6e30-4228-b395-985fbcc697b3 exists. It doesn't:

(Pdb) self.obj_context.session.query(segments_db.NetworkSegment).all()
[]

That is why you are getting foreign key constraint violation: you are trying to create a PortBindingLevel object that points (with a foreign key field) to a NetworkSegment object that hasn't been created.

This means that the setup code of the tests has to create a NetworkSegment object before creating a PortBindingLevel object. Hope this helps"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-14 22:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Verified-1

OK I will need to look at it tomorrow. Stay tuned!'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2016-12-08 20:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2016-12-15 17:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

OK, I finally looked at the failures today. Several things:

1. turns out that PortBindingLevelDbObjectTestCase is not really executed (you should inherit from testlib_api.SqlTestCase in addition to obj_test_base.BaseDbObjectTestCase to make it work).

2. at least one of the problems that hit you is that Level.create() does not create relevant NetworkSegment object stored in .segment field. So when ml2 db gets to calling level.create(), we end up with .segment == None. You should update definition of Level object in a way that would create/update/delete NetworkSegment object on .create/update call. You can find examples in other objects on how to write create/update methods to achieve it.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2016-12-15 17:42:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 22774, 'date': '2016-12-15 17:58:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

@Ihar Thanks for the review. Regarding the changes to be made to level object, we found out that introducing a field called 'segment_id' solves this issue. This way, we will have segment_id in PortBindingLevel.segment.id and PortBindingLevel.segment_id. I understand that this becomes redundant. But everything works fine when it is introduced. I will introduce this in the next patch set."}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2016-12-15 18:04:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 29:

> @Ihar Thanks for the review. Regarding the changes to be made to
 > level object, we found out that introducing a field called
 > 'segment_id' solves this issue. This way, we will have segment_id
 > in PortBindingLevel.segment.id and PortBindingLevel.segment_id. I
 > understand that this becomes redundant. But everything works fine
 > when it is introduced. I will introduce this in the next patch set.

I think we have a way forward, if we make the level object update its synthetic fields accordingly. It's a bug in object persistence layer, and hence should be fixed. segment_id is a hack around the bug."}, {'account_id': 22776, 'date': '2016-12-15 20:24:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15518, 'date': '2016-12-16 09:37:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

(1 comment)

"It's a bug in object persistence layer,"
You mean in OVO or db layer?'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2016-12-16 11:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > "It's a bug in object persistence layer,"
 > You mean in OVO or db layer?

I mean that the Level object should make sure that on create/update, its synthetic fields, including segment, are actually stored in db.'}, {'account_id': 22220, 'date': '2016-12-16 22:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 30.'}, {'account_id': 20330, 'date': '2016-12-16 23:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 30:

'}, {'created': '2017-10-03 21:14:07.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Integration of Port Binding Level OVO

I just rebased it, now I have to check what is wrong/good with it :)

This patch integrates Port Binding Level OVO in /plugin/ml2/db.py

commit_message:
Integration of Port Binding Level OVO

This patch integrates Port Binding Level OVO in /plugin/ml2/db.py
and introduces context instead of session for usage in object
operations.

Change-Id: Ifa779f5f70a7502bd96b34d64a84d272af2a6886
Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Co-Authored-By: Anindita Das <anindita.das@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Slawek Kaplonski <slawek@kaplonski.pl>

commit_message:
Bind mount the database client settings in sahara_db_sync

Apparently not doing this break the bootstrap container in some cases
(for example when TLS everywhere is enabled). This case is not really
supported by Sahara right now, but better fix it in advance.

More details about this change are available in the similar patches
that landed for other components:
- Cinder: https://review.openstack.org/539498
- Manila: https://review.openstack.org/594801

Change-Id: Iab8ad50f4397ee9809f50d1474026d5ff8a6972c

[{'created': '2018-09-19 00:06:03.000000000', 'message': "Add more optionality when customizing node roles

The node roles would apply attributes to hosts if an override was set or
if a node was part of a given group as determined through auto-detection.
This change will now add nodes to a given role when set manually and
will ensure no extra nodes are added to the role if the count meets or
exceeds what's required to run the service.

Change-Id: Ied5f564f0328488d3359ec4dc8e9ad17fefe5eaf

The node roles would apply attributes to hosts if an override was set or
if a node was part of a given group as determined through auto-detection.
This change will now add nodes to a given role when set manually and
will ensure no extra nodes are added to the role if the count meets or

Change-Id: Ied5f564f0328488d3359ec4dc8e9ad17fefe5eaf

commit_message:
Add more optionality when customizing node roles

The node roles would apply attributes to hosts if an override was set or
if a node was part of a given group as determined through auto-detection.
This change will now add nodes to a given role when set manually and
will ensure no extra nodes are added to the role if the count meets or
exceeds what's required to run the service.

Change-Id: Ied5f564f0328488d3359ec4dc8e9ad17fefe5eaf
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add playbook to automatically refresh fields in kibana

When upgrading or updating a template fields within kibana will not be
updated until they're manually refreshed. This change uses the kibana
API to gather field information from the indexes and update kibana
automatically.

Change-Id: Ia5de566521d79da070f4377d1d7cb4d9786447b4
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use with statement to enforce file close

We found some race conditions at overcloud deploy, looks like after
running 55-heat-config, the -notify.json files are not there yet.

This review enforce a close() of the file with a with statement

Change-Id: I7d342893d790efa798ff8df379c6942eca5b7ec3

We have switched to Zuul v3 now, this change does not apply anymore.

Learn on how to update your change with Zuul v3 at
https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html .

Simplified:
* Job definitions can be in-repo; common job definitions are in
  openstack-infra/openstack-zuul-jobs repository
* Job scheduling can be done in-repo for project specific changes,
  common jobs are configured via
  openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml

Read the above mentioned document for finer details.

Please decide whether this change is still needed and then adopt if
for Zuul v3 or abandon it.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2017-12-18 01:29:30.000000000', 'content': 'Removed reviewer Jenkins with the following votes:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-02-13 03:55:49.000000000', 'message': 'Move coverage jobs to non-voting gate jobs

There was a thread some time ago that suggested coverage jobs weren't
doing much in the "post" pipeline because nobody looks at them and the
change numbers may be difficult to find anyway [1].  This came up
again in a cleanup to add non-voting coverage jobs in
I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc

There really is no consistency across projects; it seems like a couple
of different approaches have been cargo-cult copied as new projects
came in, depending on which random project was used as a template.

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the
check queue as non-voting jobs.  In some cases the coverage jobs were
duplicated between the check/gate and post pipelines -- in this case
the post jobs are removed but the others left as is.

The coverage jobs are changed to our standard "gate-" naming prefix.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099491.html

Change-Id: I4e64bb803929f1dbaef26bf513d3a0afa91484d8
'}, {'created': '2017-02-13 23:03:56.000000000', 'message': 'Move coverage jobs to non-voting gate jobs

came in, depending on which random project was used as a template.

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the
check queue as non-voting jobs.  In some cases the coverage jobs were
duplicated between the check/gate and post pipelines -- in this case
the post jobs are removed but the others left as is.

The coverage jobs are changed to our standard "gate-" naming prefix.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099491.html

Change-Id: I4e64bb803929f1dbaef26bf513d3a0afa91484d8

'}, {'created': '2018-09-06 18:11:44.000000000', 'message': 'Move coverage jobs to non-voting gate jobs

There was a thread some time ago that suggested coverage jobs weren't
doing much in the "post" pipeline because nobody looks at them and the
change numbers may be difficult to find anyway [1].  This came up
again in a cleanup to add non-voting coverage jobs in
I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc

There really is no consistency across projects; it seems like a couple
of different approaches have been cargo-cult copied as new projects
came in, depending on which random project was used as a template.

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the
check queue as non-voting jobs using the template "openstack-cover-jobs".

Note that only repos are updated that are not currently in the process
of the python3-first migration, these repos need separate handling
in-repo.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099491.html

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the

commit_message:
Move coverage jobs to voting check job

There was a thread some time ago that suggested coverage jobs weren't
doing much in the "post" pipeline because nobody looks at them and the
change numbers may be difficult to find anyway [1].  This came up
again in a cleanup to add non-voting coverage jobs in
I5c42530d1dda41b8dc8c13cdb10458745bec7bcc

There really is no consistency across projects; it seems like a couple
of different approaches have been cargo-cult copied as new projects
came in, depending on which random project was used as a template.

This change does a cleanup by moving all post coverage jobs into the
check queue as voting jobs using the template "openstack-cover-jobs".
For infra repos that use "tox-cover", the set up is changed to use a
voting check job.

Note that only repos are updated that are not currently in the process
of the python3-first migration, these repos need separate handling
in-repo.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-July/099491.html

Co-Authored-By: Andreas Jaeger <jaegerandi@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Ian Wienand <iwienand@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4e64bb803929f1dbaef26bf513d3a0afa91484d8

I really had the impression it was this:

Just curious how does the publishing works with this, and will https://docs.openstack.org/ha-guide/ be overriden? I don't see any depends-on on the commit message..."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-18 02:19:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Good question Jean-Philippe. This uses direct publishing, so it should show up under docs.o.o/ha-guide. There is content from openstack-manuals that currently gets published to that location. I need to submit a patch yet to remove that content from the openstack-manuals repo so it doesn't publish there anymore. Until then, the two repos will overwrite each other each time a patch merges."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-18 02:27:41.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to ha-guide'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-18 02:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

openstack-manuals content removal in https://review.openstack.org/603272'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-09-19 20:57:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Will there be a follow-up patch to add the contents too?

Or does the ops community want to start from scratch? 

If we are keeping the links to ha-guide, then we probably don't want to point to placeholder content, so migrating the contents would be preferred."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-19 21:00:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The plan as I understood it in Denver was that Adam would take the content from ha-guide-draft in the openstack-manuals repo and get that moved over. Then the next step after that would be to remove that content from openstack-manuals as a final cleanup.

If something blocks that work for whatever reason, we can probably quickly get at least some content pushed here so someone landing on this page can get some details or get pointers to where they should go for more.'}, {'account_id': 20156, 'date': '2018-09-19 21:24:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks, that sounds like a plan then.

Adam, any timeframe for moving the contents from the ha-guide-draft? It would be great not to have the placeholder content in ha-guide for too long.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-09-20 10:03:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(9 comments)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-09-20 10:04:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Nothing I'm going to block on, but if you fancy cleaning this up now, I'd appreciate it :)"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-20 13:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17556, 'date': '2018-09-20 19:15:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15993, 'date': '2018-09-20 19:17:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-21 05:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 2394, 'date': '2018-09-21 16:22:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Adam, any timeframe for moving the contents from the ha-guide-draft? It would be great not to have the placeholder content in ha-guide for too long.

Well, you guys were so fast you managed to kick this off even before I caught up with my post-PTG backlog ;-o  So I guess this is gonna somehow make me feel the heat and force me to find time for it soon, which is good... in a kind of painful way ;-)  I'll try to make a *start* on it next week, although realistically I think it will probably take at least 2-3 weeks before I can make significant headway.  I feel good about the new governance structure we settled on though!"}]

This just sets up all the framework pieces to allow content to be added

commit_message:
Fix haproxy when there's an haproxy apparmor profile

The haproxy apparmor profile, when it exists, is overly restrictive and
will cause haproxy to not start on reboot. This change looks for the
profile and when present makes it permisive. While it'd be great to make
this profile, when found, enforcing, we'll need to enlist an apparmor
expert to make the needed changes.

Change-Id: I441f8e6e98de53d8b60da870abb0d269bdd7ae77
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

[{'created': '2017-10-24 02:36:30.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Improve scalability of querying volumes

Currently we query volumes in vCenter by name which is not scalable.
Commit 6b9464e91840f6e006f537dcd3c0f656ae90a179 sets the backend
volume ID to Cinder volume ID so that we can use vCenter SearchIndex
API to query backend volumes by Cinder volume ID.

This patch uses SearchIndex API to improve scalability. But this type
of querying will not work for legacy volumes whose vCenter ID is not
set to Cinder volume ID. To handle those volumes, we build a cache to
map their names to vCenter references during driver setup.

Closes-bug: #1600754

commit_message:
VMware: Improve scalability of querying volumes

Currently we query volumes in vCenter by name which is not scalable.
Commit 6b9464e91840f6e006f537dcd3c0f656ae90a179 sets the backend
volume ID to Cinder volume ID so that we can use vCenter SearchIndex
API to query backend volumes by Cinder volume ID.

This patch uses SearchIndex API to improve scalability. But this type
of querying will not work for legacy volumes whose vCenter ID is not
set to Cinder volume ID. To handle those volumes, we build a cache to
map their names to vCenter references during driver setup.

Closes-bug: #1600754
Change-Id: I6b49c2590d0bd3946fa03dbac08ab4f778007111

commit_message:
Clean flake8 ignore

There is no bad code violating PEP-8 and no need to ignore rules
E123 and E125. So clean the ignore list to do a more strict check.
Same patch we can refer to:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/169409/

Change-Id: I0e1e05209e33465af6658060503097739ebb5b9d

commit_message:
Remove when condition in roles/swift/tasks/deploy.yml

Because all task in deploy.yml need run in all swift host,
so we don't need the when condition.

Change-Id: Ibd61ce2615985cbad70c13a37c863fc6e5e858e4

Modify the '.gitignore' file

Since the horizon remove the 'run_tests.sh' file,
so there should remove '.venv' from the '.gitignore' file.

commit_message:
Provide support for ceilometer dev mode in kolla

Add a possibility to mount sources as volumes to containers,
in "more than documentation" way. That will let us to use kolla
as a replacement for devstack.

Co-Authored-By: ZhijunWei <wzj334965317@outlook.com>
Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources

Change-Id: I7db7d7f0d13a4a17d1884f2cb6fa6f2c37cb0e2b

commit_message:
dev mode: Add support for vitrage

Provide support for kolla dev mode in vitrage. When
'kolla_dev_mode' or 'vitrage_dev_mode' variables are
enabled, source code of vitrage project is cloned
and bind mounted.

Partially implements: blueprint mount-sources
Co-Authored-By: zhulingjie <easyzlj@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I095f2b33857abbdd0167ae52899407f2d86229d0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-15 22:53:02.000000000', 'message': "Fix _attachment_reserve to not allow attaching an invalid status volume

It is currently possible to create a volume attachment for a server
when the volume is in error status because of the override logic
in the _attachment_reserve method. What results is that the volume
attach operation fails in nova-compute which rolls back and deletes
the volume attachment, which puts the volume into 'available' status
because it no longer has any attachments, which in fact it should
have never allowed the attachment create/reserve in the first place.

This updates the override logic such that a volume without any
attachments which is in an invalid status will result in an error
being raised.

Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume.py
    cinder/volume/api.py

Change-Id: Id9cf2f510684cd296ffbcaf53d11889cfe8973b9
Closes-Bug: #1785050
(cherry picked from commit 9c0123eb70b0928786d81469cc3ccbd4f30f38fe)
(cherry picked from commit 1c06339d6a805146e777cdba8ef550f14bada9b2)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix _attachment_reserve to not allow attaching an invalid status volume

It is currently possible to create a volume attachment for a server
when the volume is in error status because of the override logic
in the _attachment_reserve method. What results is that the volume
attach operation fails in nova-compute which rolls back and deletes
the volume attachment, which puts the volume into 'available' status
because it no longer has any attachments, which in fact it should
have never allowed the attachment create/reserve in the first place.

This updates the override logic such that a volume without any
attachments which is in an invalid status will result in an error
being raised.

Conflicts:
    cinder/tests/unit/volume/test_volume.py
    cinder/volume/api.py

Change-Id: Id9cf2f510684cd296ffbcaf53d11889cfe8973b9
Closes-Bug: #1785050
(cherry picked from commit 9c0123eb70b0928786d81469cc3ccbd4f30f38fe)
(cherry picked from commit 1c06339d6a805146e777cdba8ef550f14bada9b2)

commit_message:
Add parameter limits for mappings

The cost of hashmapmappings should be positive, the level and cost
of hashmapthresholds should be positive.Now, limit them, if they
are not positive, raise InvalidInputError.

Change-Id: I9e60740466771dfd24a9153afe607589001b9da2

[{'created': '2018-09-21 11:22:44.000000000', 'message': "ut: Patch get_ident for race transaction test

In case eventlet is installed on the system, the time.sleep() function
doesn't yield.  This patch replaces time.sleep with eventlet.sleep and
thread.get_ident functions on systems with eventlet installed. With this
patch, a concurrent transaction test can be executed both with and
without eventlet successfuly.

Related-bug: #1793499
"}]
commit_message:
ut: Patch get_ident for race transaction test

In case eventlet is installed on the system, the time.sleep() function
doesn't yield.  This patch replaces time.sleep with eventlet.sleep and
thread.get_ident functions on systems with eventlet installed. With this
patch, a concurrent transaction test can be executed both with and
without eventlet successfuly.

Change-Id: I4572355d7d420111e562d4d1f4ea3dd95d4e3f7d
Related-bug: #1793499

commit_message:
Make nested transaction thread aware

Previously, if create_transaction() was called from different threads or
greenthreads, always a single transaction was returned even when the
thread was different.

This patch makes a map between thread ID and a transaction therefore
nested transaction is returned only for the same threads.

Change-Id: I884e7973d05434d798e0aeaa0f1f826905a8113e
Closes-bug: 1793499
Closes-bug: 1735154
(cherry picked from commit 9c07fe8310bec8939cde99018d10482a7c820b61)
(cherry picked from commit fcf7487d1fecf803157508866dbea0c1d6c12872)

commit_message:
Make nested transaction thread aware

Previously, if create_transaction() was called from different threads or
greenthreads, always a single transaction was returned even when the
thread was different.

This patch makes a map between thread ID and a transaction therefore
nested transaction is returned only for the same threads.

Change-Id: I884e7973d05434d798e0aeaa0f1f826905a8113e
Closes-bug: 1793499
Closes-bug: 1735154
(cherry picked from commit 9c07fe8310bec8939cde99018d10482a7c820b61)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-16 12:39:57.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add SR-IOV binding driver to CNI

This commit includes a binding driver for SR-IOV interfaces. The driver
scans VFs of a PF for each SR-IOV interface requested and assignes them
to the Pod.

This commit adds new config parameter `physical_device_mappings`.
It is similar to neutron-sriov-nic-agent and helps manage PFs and physnets.

Change-Id: Icda852cef35efdb75daeae78f7a093fe516f4c02
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@partner.samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add SR-IOV binding driver to CNI

This commit includes a binding driver for SR-IOV interfaces. The driver
scans VFs of a PF for each SR-IOV interface requested and assignes them
to the Pod.

This commit adds new config parameter `physical_device_mappings`.
It is similar to neutron-sriov-nic-agent and helps manage PFs and physnets.

Implements: blueprint kuryr-kubernetes-sriov-support
Change-Id: Icda852cef35efdb75daeae78f7a093fe516f4c02
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@partner.samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>
Signed-off-by: Vladimir Kuramshin <v.kuramshin@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Removes unused utf-8 encoding declaration

Following files contain #-*- coding: utf-8 -*- declaration
but don't contain any unicode character

cloudkittyclient/__init__.py
cloudkittyclient/tests/base.py
cloudkittyclient/tests/test_cloudkittyclient.py
doc/source/conf.py

Change-Id: I2664312d9ea3e91a77e12e1c63b689c94248c29e

commit_message:
Implement: ranger helm charts and supporting change for agent

This is an effort to implement helm charts for ranger component
Included integration changes needed in ranger-agent

 Signed-off-by: Hari Om Singh<hosingh000@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I27911d134882365a29b7ffcf1f7ab2e38cf717be

commit_message:
Get rid of keys() usage

for x in some_dict.keys() can be written as for x in some_dict

Change-Id: I82fd2b3ecdf482d130fc1bca545d2221ffc513cc
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chucks@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add Python 3.5 classifier and venv

Now that there is a passing gate job, we can claim
support for Python 3.5 in the classifier.
This patch also adds the convenience py35 venv.

Change-Id: I4d36a29b002d3935b2587b77b06b53a2b3d06838

[{'created': '2018-09-21 12:27:35.000000000', 'message': "Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role

Change-Id: Ieb2bedd3a6ebd005f224a26010066c8d6f7928ef
"}]
commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ieb2bedd3a6ebd005f224a26010066c8d6f7928ef

commit_message:
Make haproxy proxy to the right glance_api backend

Since glance_api only start one container when using file
backend, the haproxy should follow this rule.

See: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/448654

Closes-Bug: #1722422

Change-Id: Id3519581e0f54509dacd24d0dd542c630342c771

commit_message:
Temporarily remove the rabbitmq clusterer plugin

In order to migrate to the latest release of rabbitmq (3.7), we need to
first remove this deprecated plugin which is no longer supported (the
problems it solved are now addressed in rabbitmq itself).

This avoids a circular dependency in CI where the new images depend on
the new clustering and the new clustering depends on the new images.

Change-Id: I921459f3e40b9e0d4af9497384e49aabf0abe79b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-03 21:29:37.000000000', 'message': "Optimize AZ lookup during schedule_and_build_instances

If we're creating multiple servers, there is a chance
the scheduler returned the same host for more than
one of them, which means we could be redundantly
looking up the AZ for the same host multiple times.
This could happen when creating multiple servers in
the same strict affinity group, or simply if the
scheduler is configured with a pack-first strategy
for filling up hosts. The get_host_availability_zone()
method does not use its own internal cache, so this
change adds a simple cache to the schedule_and_build_instances
method itself so that we only lookup the AZ per unique
host once.

Note that build_instances suffers from the same issue
but that is only called for scheduling with cells v1
which is deprecated so we shouldn't need to care about
optimizing that method.

Change-Id: I2ae5ae7240e5183acca7492ddad017c0c878835b
Closes-Bug: #1785327
"}]
commit_message:
Optimize AZ lookup during schedule_and_build_instances

If we're creating multiple servers, there is a chance
the scheduler returned the same host for more than
one of them, which means we could be redundantly
looking up the AZ for the same host multiple times.
This could happen when creating multiple servers in
the same strict affinity group, or simply if the
scheduler is configured with a pack-first strategy
for filling up hosts. The get_host_availability_zone()
method does not use its own internal cache, so this
change adds a simple cache to the schedule_and_build_instances
method itself so that we only lookup the AZ per unique
host once.

Note that build_instances suffers from the same issue
but that is only called for scheduling with cells v1
which is deprecated so we shouldn't need to care about
optimizing that method.

Change-Id: I2ae5ae7240e5183acca7492ddad017c0c878835b
Closes-Bug: #1785327

commit_message:
Fix bluestore disk naming format in kolla-ansible

The current bluestore disk label naming is inconsistent with the
filestore. The filestore naming format is that the disk prefixes
belonging to the same osd are the same and the suffixes are
different.

This patch keeps the bluestore's disk naming as well.

Change-Id: I71dda29fc4a6765300ce7bb173d2c448c24f6eca
(cherry picked from commit 4e5e28fff53abf526042c965f6770c28c7c37742)

commit_message:
Fix Extended maintenance date for Rocky

Rocky should switch to extended maintenance 18 months
after the initial release, which places it in February
of 2020, not of 2019.

Change-Id: Ie134c96cc2ac5fc7e2ba54282d9734b49c0be3eb

commit_message:
Add option for default pip package install

Add an option to define a default set of python packages to install
within a virtual environment. This can be used to install a package
wihin a virtual environment that may be outside of a normal package
list but for a given service.

Change-Id: Ic2dc024049062ad9be396a1f71435f661576e91b
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 5818696cf6e20860f94c2d54f2aa102a369c8a20)

commit_message:
Placement: support mixing required traits with any traits

The previous spec I57c5611d7443070c176d213118857261b37eca0c proposed
to allow querying traits in the form of required=in:TRAIT1,TRAIT2.
This spec goes one step forward and propose to allow repeating the
required query parameter to support mixing both
required=TRAIT1,TRAIT2,!TRAIT3 and required=in:TRAIT1,TRAIT2 format
in a single query. This is needed for Neutron to be able to express
that a port needs a resource provider having a specific vnic_type
trait but also having one of the physnet traits the port's network maps
to.

bp mixing-required-traits-with-any-traits

Change-Id: I9695f0cb2c0263cd0e8ca552d3a9dd720690e466

The GET /allocation_candidates request in Placement supports the
required query parameter. If the caller specifies a list of traits
in the required parameter then placement will limit the returned
allocation candidates to those RP trees that fulfill *every* traits in
that list. To support minimum bandwidth guarantees in Neutron + Nova we
need to be able to query allocation candidates that fulfill at least
one trait from a list of traits specified in the query. This is

physnet but theport's bandwidth request can be fulfilled from any
physnet the port's network maps to.

commit_message:
Placement: any traits in allocation_candidate query

The GET /allocation_candidates request in Placement supports the
required query parameter. If the caller specifies a list of traits
in the required parameter then placement will limit the returned
allocation candidates to those RP trees that fulfill *every* traits in
that list. To support minimum bandwidth guarantees in Neutron + Nova we
need to be able to query allocation candidates that fulfill at least
one trait from a list of traits specified in the query. This is
required for the case when a Neutron network maps to more than one
physnet but the port's bandwidth request can be fulfilled from any
physnet the port's network maps to.

bp any-traits-in-allocation-candidates-query

Change-Id: I57c5611d7443070c176d213118857261b37eca0c

[{'created': '2018-08-22 01:59:58.000000000', 'message': 'import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ibda14345a45891af54182a9673bec50b7b304cd9
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I3a6c04807b4bad36c5d9b378db71bd76257ff888
(cherry picked from commit 5f85707423ef748bd3afeb8a2653253726bdadf7)

commit_message:
RedHat: Use the distribution package

The RDO repository provids a rabbitmq-server which is tested by the
RDO team so we should use that instead of the external one. We also
skip several tasks which add gpg keys and external repositories
since none of these steps is necessary when we install packages
from the distro repos.

Change-Id: I7c0a988f3aab14042ac2491b1021e789ba9ef4b3

[{'created': '2018-08-14 05:45:07.000000000', 'message': "Delete instance_id_mappings record in instance_destroy

The instance_create DB API creates an instance_id_mappings record
but instance_destroy was not cleaning it up when the instance is
deleted; this adds that delete code. Otherwise those records
never get moved to shadow tables so you can't archive and purge them.

Change-Id: Idfe52d3c2f987b9aac551f013a0990423d87fad3
Closes-Bug: #1786298
"}]
commit_message:
Delete instance_id_mappings record in instance_destroy

The instance_create DB API creates an instance_id_mappings record
but instance_destroy was not cleaning it up when the instance is
deleted; this adds that delete code. Otherwise those records
never get moved to shadow tables so you can't archive and purge them.

Change-Id: Idfe52d3c2f987b9aac551f013a0990423d87fad3
Closes-Bug: #1786298

subject: Clean up role tests
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 18:37:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 18:37:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 18:38:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 18:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from cleanup-tole-tests-stable/ocata to cleanup-role-tests-stable/ocata'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-20 10:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 17799, 'date': '2018-09-21 12:40:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-09-21 13:31:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 18:37:00.000000000', 'message': "Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
3. We promote the jobs which appear to be reliably working.

   more obvious and easier to change later.

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
2. We promote the jobs which appear to be reliably working.
3. We rename the tox target for 'func_ovs' to 'ovs' as the
   'func_' prefix is pointless.
4. We rename the '-nv' jobs to without that suffix, and move
   the non-voting argument to the projects file to make it
   more obvious and easier to change later.

Change-Id: Ic2f8a999cc084da76fade0000d2e6198b025c38a
(cherry picked from commit 2c847b53cbbaee5801c549c98b160f9b8c7786ae)

commit_message:
Remove tempest testing and clean up role tests

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I28ff7b95d3b2cc064c59c9966e9c25c7ad9184da
(cherry picked from commit 939df557398f755b50116e0dad66032d4c2b1bb8)

subject: Set logs_dir during CI image build, redirect output
messages: [{'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-21 11:28:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-21 14:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nFix in kolla should be sufficient.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-21 11:28:02.000000000', 'message': 'Set logs_dir during CI image build, redirect output

If images are built during CI jobs, then the job can sometimes fail due
to the output being too long for Gerrit. This message is seen:

Length too long: <length>

This change redirects the build output to
/tmp/logs/build/kolla-build.log, and sets logs_dir in kolla-build.conf
to ensure we get individual build logs for each image.

Change-Id: I06baa4934f0b2f4bbc2df93f9d0f50f06707f205
'}]
commit_message:
Set logs_dir during CI image build, redirect output

If images are built during CI jobs, then the job can sometimes fail due
to the output being too long for Gerrit. This message is seen:

Length too long: <length>

This change redirects the build output to
/tmp/logs/build/kolla-build.log, and sets logs_dir in kolla-build.conf
to ensure we get individual build logs for each image.

Change-Id: I06baa4934f0b2f4bbc2df93f9d0f50f06707f205

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I846e41f9e8a505c40ed7c544cb51374802bdaf0a
Story: #2002586
Task: #24303

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: If7e23cf13f9c51b9eaeb1ac0e4db2c0756c87698
Story: #2002586
Task: #24303

[{'created': '2018-05-30 23:20:09.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (6)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the LibvirtDriverTestCase
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* _test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_resize_check
* test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_lvm
* test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_resize_cannot_ssh
* test_wait_for_running
* _test_finish_revert_migration
* test_cleanup_failed_migration
* test_confirm_migration
* test_get_instance_disk_info_exception
* _test_attach_interface
* test_detach_interface_device_with_same_mac_address

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I0cd5fc54d981acbf6a63ae74e272f83f24246c70
Implements: blueprint mox-removal
'}, {'created': '2018-06-03 22:45:26.000000000', 'message': 'Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (6)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the LibvirtDriverTestCase
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* _test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_resize_check
* test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_lvm
* test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_resize_cannot_ssh
* test_wait_for_running
* _test_finish_revert_migration
* test_cleanup_failed_migration
* test_confirm_migration
* test_get_instance_disk_info_exception
* _test_attach_interface
* test_detach_interface_device_with_same_mac_address

commit_message:
Remove mox in libvirt/test_driver.py (6)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following methods of
the LibvirtDriverTestCase
in nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py.

* _test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_resize_check
* test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_lvm
* test_migrate_disk_and_power_off_resize_cannot_ssh
* test_wait_for_running
* _test_finish_revert_migration
* test_cleanup_failed_migration
* test_confirm_migration
* test_get_instance_disk_info_exception
* _test_attach_interface
* test_detach_interface_device_with_same_mac_address

Subsequent patches will replace mox in other test cases.

Change-Id: I0cd5fc54d981acbf6a63ae74e272f83f24246c70
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-stein

commit_message:
Remove mox in test_compute_api.py (4)

Replace mox with mock or stub_out in the following
methods in nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py.

* test_resize_quota_exceeds_fails
* test_pause
* test_unpause
* _test_snapshot_and_backup
* _test_snapshot_volume_backed
* test_volume_snapshot_create
* test_volume_snapshot_delete

This patch completes replacing mox in the file.

Change-Id: I7d5bddc0aa1833cda5f4bcebe5e03bdd447f641a
Implements: blueprint mox-removal-stein

commit_message:
EMC ScaleIO driver does not honor create from snapshot volume size

create_volume_from_snapshot can specify a volume size
larger than the orginal snapshot.
Current code does not appear to handle this size difference.
This patch addresses the issue.

Change-Id: Ifa247ef0eec00c23afe6f875107a06f756bc180e
Closes-Bug: #1560649

commit_message:
[Logging] Enable filtering of trace_api logs

This improvement allows trace_api decorators to be
passed a filter function argument, which can validate
the parameters of the object being logged to decide
to not filter it.

Change-Id: I2dbf5583b8d2c9b9afe35bc5a916f480637d79f5
(cherry picked from commit b9e1552016abfdc6366dd3b1e4129c691664359b)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 11:49:49.000000000', 'message': 'Fix missing specifying doctrees directory

In tox.ini file, the doctrees directory is specified
as an argument of sphinx-build command in api-guide, api-ref,
placement-api-ref, releasenotes targets.
But it is missing in docs. So add it.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I74ea98b1330c1c550dae53fafc79bd6e41727296
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing specifying doctrees directory

In tox.ini file, the doctrees directory is specified
as an argument of sphinx-build command in api-guide, api-ref,
placement-api-ref, releasenotes targets.
But it is missing in docs. So add it.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I74ea98b1330c1c550dae53fafc79bd6e41727296

the auth_uri usage in cinder.quota is totally wrong. "auth_url" is the right way.

commit_message:
Remove auth_uri usage

auth_uri in keystonemiddleware was deprecated and will be removed
in Stein.

This patch changed it to auth_url or www_authenticate_uri correctly

Change-Id: I754f6b27b3ebb87d4479aa366c9ee04af34fcaab

commit_message:
Adjust metalsmith ACL to match ones of an official project

metalsmith is now a part of the ironic project, so dropping tagging
and creating branches privileges from a special group.

Also add metalsmith to #openstack-ironic IRC.

Governance change: https://review.openstack.org/602075

Change-Id: I716e25e3eee451cc00845c0f3be06d82216f7e50

Need more investigate when do not stop all services before run flush_handlers. Upgrade gate was failed at 

TASK [nova : Sighup nova-api]
"Error response from daemon: Container ID is not running"'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-08-06 07:58:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

> (1 comment)

The nova upgrade document says this:

"For maximum safety (no failed API operations), gracefully shutdown all the services (i.e. SIG_TERM) except nova-compute."

This suggests that the safety referred to here is about failing API operations. If you shutdown all the services, then they can't fail API operations. However, they will also not be available.

It seems like this is something the operator might want to decide on - do we ensure API availability, at the expense of some operations failing? That could be captured via a variable. To be able to call it a rolling upgrade though, I think we should not stop the services by default.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-08-06 07:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 25:

There is also a check command that we could use prior to running the upgrade: https://docs.openstack.org/nova/latest/cli/nova-status.html#nova-status-checks.'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-08-09 09:43:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-08-09 09:47:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 26:

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ic6fb1f925df766984bc37bc56323ed35e78bb737
Story: #2002586
Task: #24303

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I2738daf858e1e4dada66463d0e4500226d2982fc
Story: #2002586
Task: #24303

commit_message:
Add support for container-only network interface

Configuring a dummy/loopback interface in the container needs no
configuration on the physical host. So we add support for a
"container_only" flag to the container_networks dict, allowing
deployers to flag an interface to be configured in the container
but not on the host.

Change-Id: Ibfa9db75a1b5f31367289107574d6cc9f1b1c800

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I2d7496d4d4fd4c8d10a355246fc5d5b26bd14d52
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c0199182150df5ba0d850510efbfb512bf7ff)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-03 04:40:17.000000000', 'message': "Ignore conditions when reparsing ResourceDefinition

In the legacy path we reparse a resource definition to refer to a different
StackDefinition when copying a resource definition into the existing
template (as the resource is updated) or into the backup stack's template.
However, the resources 'condition' may reference conditionals that are not
defined in the template it is being copied into (e.g. during a stack update
that creates a new condition), and in this case the destination template
will become unusable.

Since the fact that we care about the resource definition at all indicates
that the condition was enabled, just ignore the condition after reparsing.
This is consistent with what we do for 'if' macros, which is to resolve the
condition part during reparsing.

Change-Id: I59a374435f6275badc8124efbd7b7db2e36e2de5
Story: #2003558
Task: 24847
(cherry picked from commit 92101b18e260665718fb9d795c3f6ee2148f8ac5)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore conditions when reparsing ResourceDefinition

In the legacy path we reparse a resource definition to refer to a different
StackDefinition when copying a resource definition into the existing
template (as the resource is updated) or into the backup stack's template.
However, the resources 'condition' may reference conditionals that are not
defined in the template it is being copied into (e.g. during a stack update
that creates a new condition), and in this case the destination template
will become unusable.

Since the fact that we care about the resource definition at all indicates
that the condition was enabled, just ignore the condition after reparsing.
This is consistent with what we do for 'if' macros, which is to resolve the
condition part during reparsing.

Change-Id: I59a374435f6275badc8124efbd7b7db2e36e2de5
Story: #2003558
Task: 24847
(cherry picked from commit 92101b18e260665718fb9d795c3f6ee2148f8ac5)

subject: Ignore spurious nested stack locks in convergence
messages:
[{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-09-08 00:32:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-09-19 17:26:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Looks good for backport and merged to master.

Earlier branch cherry-picks should be -W until later branches are merged.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-21 09:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2018-09-21 11:07:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-08 00:32:39.000000000', 'message': "Ignore spurious nested stack locks in convergence

Several operations (e.g. stack check) are yet to be converted to
convergence-style workflows, and still create locks. While we try to always
remove dead locks, it's possible that if one of these gets left behind we
won't notice, since convergence doesn't actually use stack locks for most
regular operations.

When doing _check_status_complete() on a nested stack resource, we wait for
the operation to release the nested stack's lock before reporting the
resource completed, to ensure that for legacy operations the nested stack
is ready to perform another action on as soon as the resource is complete.
For convergence stacks this is an unnecessary DB call, and it can lead to
resources never completing if a stray lock happens to be left in the
database.

Only check the nested stack's stack lock for operations where we are not
taking a resource lock. This corresponds exactly to legacy-style
operations.

Change-Id: I4eb20ad82cc3e9434da34500fafa3880567d0959
Story: #1727142
Task: 24939
(cherry picked from commit 83ae156927f879af59d7db518f888280ef369428)
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore spurious nested stack locks in convergence

Several operations (e.g. stack check) are yet to be converted to
convergence-style workflows, and still create locks. While we try to always
remove dead locks, it's possible that if one of these gets left behind we
won't notice, since convergence doesn't actually use stack locks for most
regular operations.

When doing _check_status_complete() on a nested stack resource, we wait for
the operation to release the nested stack's lock before reporting the
resource completed, to ensure that for legacy operations the nested stack
is ready to perform another action on as soon as the resource is complete.
For convergence stacks this is an unnecessary DB call, and it can lead to
resources never completing if a stray lock happens to be left in the
database.

Only check the nested stack's stack lock for operations where we are not
taking a resource lock. This corresponds exactly to legacy-style
operations.

Change-Id: I4eb20ad82cc3e9434da34500fafa3880567d0959
Story: #1727142
Task: 24939
(cherry picked from commit 83ae156927f879af59d7db518f888280ef369428)

commit_message:
py3: Switch manila to run under Python 3 at Rocky

Switch charm to run manila under Python 3 for Rocky or later:

 - Force use of python3-manila
 - Purge python-* packages previously installed on upgrade
 - Tag charm class as python 3

commit_message:
Clean up watch resources after watcher.stop()

We were assuming that watcher threads will be cleaning up after
themselves - i.e. will remove paths from Watcher._watching dict on
Watcher._stop_watch(). Turns out _stop_watch() is killing the threads in
a hard way using thread.stop(). This means that paths are never removed
from Watcher._watching dict and on restart (i.e. Watcher.start()), the
method considers that there is no path that we're not already
processing and does nothing.

This commit fixes that by cleaning up Watcher._watching dict in
Watcher._stop_watch() method.

Closes-Bug: 1790912
Change-Id: I17baaab1769ca5882f0b8edf496f92ac39507969

commit_message:
Add container_id to connect method of BaseBindingDriver

container_id is necessary for VHostUserDriver, binding driver
writes its configuration to file which contains part of container id,
to be able to distinguish conf files inside containers (for case when
vhostuser socket dir mounted to several pods).

Partially-Implements: support-vhost-user-port-type-on-bm-installation
Change-Id: I328585dc6d596371d8511a3cb5ccef907d955c76
Signed-off-by: Alexey Perevalov <a.perevalov@samsung.com>

not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

2. We consolidate test-vars.yml and the overrides into a single
   file to conform to the standard in other roles and ensure
   that the overrides are only set in one place.

(cherry picked from commit 9290ccc3838635247dabdcb8c44aa47ca12c6897)

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it. The associated
   scripts are also removed.
2. We consolidate test-vars.yml and the overrides into a single
   file to conform to the standard in other roles and ensure
   that the overrides are only set in one place.

Change-Id: I2dcb1576a75c4d09c6d99e1369775301e99df770
(cherry picked from commit 9290ccc3838635247dabdcb8c44aa47ca12c6897)

commit_message:
Optimize test_volume_swap_with_multiattach for server status wait

The test creates two servers in serial and waits for each server
to go to ACTIVE status in serial. We can optimize this by creating
the two servers in parallel and waiting for them to be ACTIVE at
the same time.

Change-Id: Ia9c6db32789fd441b22d7431200283df22db3c59

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Iffee553b335d37ba481c6b142a429f4cad2e3ea7
Story: #2002586
Task: #24314

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-18 15:02:18.000000000', 'message': "Remove python-keystoneclient package install

Now that we no longer use our own keystone module, but
instead make use of the ansible runtime venv's shade
library and upstream ansible modules, we can eliminate

commit_message:
Remove python-keystoneclient package install

Now that we no longer use our own keystone module, but
instead make use of the ansible runtime venv's shade
library and upstream ansible modules, we can eliminate
this package/library being installed on the host.

Change-Id: Ib824e6e2b6e8182b2423667f03649b2bbe8da962
(cherry picked from commit 017f1d5100e7d6c359bbe3f879fd7d5d1dc78954)

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Add ability to have dlrn build all the packages at once""

This reverts commit 2af6e870456fa03d7acc5af3035eebaccb2e0388.

This includes a fix for the repo_built variable logic

It turns out ansible will always register a variable even if a task is
skipped. In this case, that means we are not properly collecting the
repo since repo_built is skipped in the second declaration.  This logic
works fine if artg_build_one is false but not if it is true (the
default)

Change-Id: I1408d9ded18cdacbd1fb5410e70de2ef8104f950

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Ic3717c372ba6fff981c79a1580e658a77d638e18
(cherry picked from commit b54f44e74bc9f6dd050a266320b07648480adcaa)
