revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 01:47:06.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tempest testing

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Change-Id: Ic21173c0a49bb9e0a348ecbbffcca8a96745595f
'}]
commit_message:
Remove tempest testing

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Change-Id: Ic21173c0a49bb9e0a348ecbbffcca8a96745595f

revisions:

This updates the apache proxies for Elasticsearch, Kibana, Nagios,
and Prometheus to use environment variables for the LDAP bind
credentials, which prevents them from being displayed in the

Change-Id: Id489978bc7701114ef847de6b311f793501a579f
'}]
commit_message:
Use env vars for LDAP bind credentials in apache proxy configs

This updates the apache proxies for Elasticsearch, Kibana, Nagios,
and Prometheus to use environment variables for the LDAP bind
credentials, which prevents them from being displayed in the
configuration files directly

Change-Id: Id489978bc7701114ef847de6b311f793501a579f

commit_message:
Use ShareInstance model to access share properties

The shares view uses the 'Share' model to access certain properties such
as the share type or the share type id. These properties are, however,
only proxied to the 'ShareInstance' model. This patch proposes to access
these properties through the 'ShareInstance' model directly in order to
avoid warning messages for proxied properties which pollute the m-api logs.

Closes-Bug: #1692058
Change-Id: I28fa366e106df51c7406673874bd993a44c500bf
(cherry picked from commit 2e6969c3fe59184e5ae8bb9d327201cc9531e11b)

commit_message:
After tempest network resource do not be cleared

When use multitenancy_enabled, mybe create net, subnet and router resources,
be used to create share network, after run the tempest those network resource
do not be cleared in the end of tempest.

Change-Id: I58a2153c0b561fc26249b4b2a4402200e63be4ce
Closes-Bug:#1755467
(cherry picked from commit 264a6029db225716e11fbb5fd7b3014459b869b1)

[{'created': '2018-09-20 14:29:29.000000000', 'message': "Ensure package cache is updated for nspawn containers

Due to differences in the way the containers are created, the
package cache must be forcefully updated after creation. If
this is not done then apt thinks that it's up to date and
fails package installs.

We also ensure that the quota is rescanned to ensure that
it is up to date.

The playbook arrangement is also updated to standardise to
the same pattern as the others.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593033
Change-Id: I44ea902b0785bdeec4565e926105d24fae18500f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9d10db61d0ca96e600fa9476ce9af7eccb6c9515)
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure package cache is updated for nspawn containers

Due to differences in the way the containers are created, the
package cache must be forcefully updated after creation. If
this is not done then apt thinks that it's up to date and
fails package installs.

We also ensure that the quota is rescanned to ensure that
it is up to date.

The playbook arrangement is also updated to standardise to
the same pattern as the others.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593033
Change-Id: I44ea902b0785bdeec4565e926105d24fae18500f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9d10db61d0ca96e600fa9476ce9af7eccb6c9515)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-15 11:19:23.000000000', 'message': "WORK IN PROGRESS - Convert the charm to Python 3 only

NOTE: This still needs a charm-helpers sync, but there are changes in
the charmhelpers folder that are NOT yet in charm-helpers; that's still
to be done.

Biggest changes:

 * decoupling the hooks/manager.py file from the charm.  It is now a
   script that is called from hooks/keystone_utils.py as it has to use
   the same Python version/libraries as the installed keystone payload
   software.  keystone_utils.py and manager.py communicate via a
   temporary file using json.  The next step will be to remove the
   manager.py file and use 'openstack' commands directly.
 * As Python3 requires absolute imports, the charmhelpers symlink has
   been removed from hooks, and the hooks and charmhelpers symlinks have
   been removed from the actions directory.  Instead, the path is
   adjusted so that the modules can be found.

Change-Id: I18996e15d2d08b1dacf0533132eae880cbb9aa32

Biggest changes:

 * decoupling the hooks/manager.py file from the charm.  It is now a
   script that is called from hooks/keystone_utils.py as it has to use
   the same Python version/libraries as the installed keystone payload
   software.  keystone_utils.py and manager.py communicate via a
   temporary file using json.  The next step will be to remove the
   manager.py file and use 'openstack' commands directly.
 * As Python3 requires absolute imports, the charmhelpers symlink has
   been removed from hooks, and the hooks and charmhelpers symlinks have
   been removed from the actions directory.  Instead, the path is
   adjusted so that the modules can be found.

Change-Id: I18996e15d2d08b1dacf0533132eae880cbb9aa32

"}, {'created': '2018-08-22 13:44:58.000000000', 'message': "!!!WIP - Convert the charm to Python 3 only

WIP: DON'T LAND: Have now achieved speed up on the py3 <-> py2 manager
using and domain socket; still need to rebase the last 6 months of
changes on to it.  Pushing release to check that nothing is broken on
the other releases, and as a base to do the final rebasing.

Major changes:

 * decoupling the hooks/manager.py file from the charm.  It is now a
   script that is called from hooks/keystone_utils.py as it has to use
   the same Python version/libraries as the installed keystone payload
   software.  keystone_utils.py and manager.py communicate via a
   temporary file using json.  The next step will be to remove the
   manager.py file and use 'openstack' commands directly.
 * As Python3 requires absolute imports, the charmhelpers symlink has
   been removed from hooks, and the hooks and charmhelpers symlinks have
   been removed from the actions directory.  Instead, the path is
   adjusted so that the modules can be found.
 * gate-basic-snap-xenial-ocata disabled as the timing in the Amulet
   library is marginal and thus leads to sporadic failures.

Change-Id: I18996e15d2d08b1dacf0533132eae880cbb9aa32
"}, {'created': '2018-08-23 14:28:33.000000000', 'message': "!!!WIP - Convert the charm to Python 3 only

WIP: DON'T LAND: In charm freeze.

Have now achieved speed up on the py3 <-> py2 manager using an domain
socket.

Major changes:

 * decoupling the hooks/manager.py file from the charm.  It is now a
   script that is called from hooks/keystone_utils.py as it has to use
   the same Python version/libraries as the installed keystone payload
   software.  keystone_utils.py and manager.py communicate via a Unix
   Domain Socket using json, encoded to base64. The next step will be to
   remove the manager.py file and use 'openstack' commands directly.
 * As Python3 requires absolute imports, the charmhelpers symlink has
   been removed from hooks, and the hooks and charmhelpers symlinks have
   been removed from the actions directory.  Instead, the path is
   adjusted so that the modules can be found.

commit_message:
Convert the charm to Python 3 only

Major changes:

 * decoupling the hooks/manager.py file from the charm.  It is now a
   script that is called from hooks/keystone_utils.py as it has to use
   the same Python version/libraries as the installed keystone payload
   software.  keystone_utils.py and manager.py communicate via a Unix
   Domain Socket using json, encoded to base64.
 * As Python3 requires absolute imports, the charmhelpers symlink has
   been removed from hooks, and the hooks and charmhelpers symlinks have
   been removed from the actions directory.  Instead, the path is
   adjusted so that the modules can be found.

Change-Id: I18996e15d2d08b1dacf0533132eae880cbb9aa32

subject: Monitor postgresql, Openstack virt resources, api, logs, pod and nodes status

commit_message:
Monitor postgresql, Openstack virt resources, api, logs, pod and nodes status

Fixing opebstack API monitors

Adding additional neutron services monitors
Adding new Pod CrashLoopBaackOff status check
Adding new Host readiness check

Updated the nagios image reference(https://review.gerrithub.io/c/att-comdev/nagios/+/420590 - Pending)

This updated image provides a mechanism for querying Elasticsearch
with the goal of triggering alerts based on specified applications
and log levels.

Finally, this moves the endpoints resulting from the authenticated
endpoint lookups required for Nagios to the nagios secret instead
of handled via plain text environment variables

Change-Id: I517d8e6e6e8fa1d359382be8a131a8e45bf243e2

commit_message:
Default enable run_validation

It was default enabled on the gate for a long time.
The option is  required to run api tests stability in case the
guest cooperation required for example volume/interface detach.

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/handling-of-interface-attach-detach-hotplug-unplug

Change-Id: I9fd433fe249cc80f6799ff240df692a5ce9275a5

commit_message:
Skip test_server_connectivity_cold_migration_revert until fixed

We're having a hard time landing changes like
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/601830/ due to
persistent intermittently failing tests that are
not getting attention to resolve, so this skips
one of those tests until the bug is fixed.

Change-Id: I7c2080acbcd47b9fb1deefd30d427f3e4076ea39
Related-Bug: #1788403

commit_message:
py3: Switch to Python 3 for OpenStack Rocky

Add rocky charm target to switch OpenStack Rocky deployments to
use Python 3.

Switch default smoke target to rocky.

Change-Id: Icd12098a7b05cad3fe82138be21b940492a74df6

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 08:29:04.000000000', 'message': 'Remove noisy DEBUG log

There is a DEBUG log coming from the notification sending code path
that tries to populate the notification payload from a nova OVO and
encounters an unset / non-lazy loadable field in the source OVO.
As there are fields like MonitorMetric.numa_membw_values that are
notorious unset in many circumstances but used in the MetricPayload
we got excessive DEBUG logging from this code path.

This patch removes the offending logging statement as soo far we failed
to found cases based on this log where anything else we could do than
what the code anyhow does, defaulting the payload field to None.

Change-Id: I680e1d9860d839a76e229c4891933872388eb050
Closes-Bug: #1788634
(cherry picked from commit 375632cbc9019f0e4e887afb5d6e48978f2a1a26)
(cherry picked from commit 3724280716703bad54d6dc434b4b1679243113d9)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove noisy DEBUG log

There is a DEBUG log coming from the notification sending code path
that tries to populate the notification payload from a nova OVO and
encounters an unset / non-lazy loadable field in the source OVO.
As there are fields like MonitorMetric.numa_membw_values that are
notorious unset in many circumstances but used in the MetricPayload
we got excessive DEBUG logging from this code path.

This patch removes the offending logging statement as soo far we failed
to found cases based on this log where anything else we could do than
what the code anyhow does, defaulting the payload field to None.

Change-Id: I680e1d9860d839a76e229c4891933872388eb050
Closes-Bug: #1788634
(cherry picked from commit 375632cbc9019f0e4e887afb5d6e48978f2a1a26)
(cherry picked from commit 3724280716703bad54d6dc434b4b1679243113d9)

commit_message:
Cleanup .zuul.yaml

* Sort template list
* Use new devstack-plugin-ceph jobs instead of legacy ones,
  these are now in the devstack-plugin-ceph repo.
* Use lower-constraints template instead of individual jobs.

Change-Id: I6baeff0ed652cfad88f93c66d49bcb6f98df7e97

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 13:36:31.000000000', 'message': 'Delete instance_group_member records from API DB during archive

Like we do for instance mappings and request specs in the API DB
when archiving deleted instances, this adds code to delete
instance group member records from the API DB when archiving deleted
instances. This should improve performance in the server groups
API because it will have a smaller set of group members to determine
if they are actually related to deleted instances, see change
Idd2e35bc95ed98ebc0340ff62e109e23c8adcb21 for context.

Change-Id: I960f8fd44d98427a72cb2bb0b238fdf2f734390f
Closes-Bug: #1751186
(cherry picked from commit 5162a9a1de3cf4d652707d8a1ff73b7b136b8053)
'}]
commit_message:
Delete instance_group_member records from API DB during archive

Like we do for instance mappings and request specs in the API DB
when archiving deleted instances, this adds code to delete
instance group member records from the API DB when archiving deleted
instances. This should improve performance in the server groups
API because it will have a smaller set of group members to determine
if they are actually related to deleted instances, see change
Idd2e35bc95ed98ebc0340ff62e109e23c8adcb21 for context.

Change-Id: I960f8fd44d98427a72cb2bb0b238fdf2f734390f
Closes-Bug: #1751186
(cherry picked from commit 5162a9a1de3cf4d652707d8a1ff73b7b136b8053)

commit_message:
Add unshelve instance error info to fault table

When the image of the SHELVED_OFFLOADED instance is deleted, the unshelve
instance will report an error, but the fault info not added into instance
fault table.

Closes-bug: #1779826

Change-Id: I365fcc148b27959acad1d3c4f8bb45c1ed790318
(cherry picked from commit b26df4fa6cd78a9b60de79750d4e9a58980d13ca)
(cherry picked from commit d543ddda02311986d5318a14dd21a3393df37c3e)

commit_message:
Use Swift's in-tree DSVM test

While we're at it, make a new job that inherits from it to bring the
legacy-swiftclient-dsvm-functional testing in-tree, too.

For naming, follow naming policy and remove "dsvm" from names.

Remove legacy jobs, they are not needed anymore.

Note this backport follows change 600346 and uses
an identity-v2 job in addition.

Change-Id: I919c0b77ac4888350194f55a9c12e0742845024f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/600346
(cherry picked from commit 70e20b62e6719c97267aa0e5a80dae2e31dfba76)

commit_message:
Revert "Use dd conv=sparse when writing images to nodes"

When using volumes, and having empty ones, the volumes are failing to
mount when using conv=sparse with dd . This is causing security
hardened volumes :
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/tree/elements/overcloud-secure/block-device-default.yaml

To fail when mounted via iscsi

This reverts commit ab0492a364b8d5ed20948e4de67f03dacaa3c38d.

Story: #2003755
Task: #26441
Change-Id: I03f53a50ada9aabe9e3fbb71106d5190ae110e01
(cherry picked from commit 3234f432e80180c6c5a95492b5ec8f7987ff3906)

commit_message:
ut: Use monkey_patch when running with eventlet

ovsdbapp doesn't have a dependency on eventlet and should work without
the library.  However, OpenStack uses eventlet heavily therefore it's
good to have support for that as well.  This patch is a follow up to
commit 9c07fe8310bec8939cde99018d10482a7c820b61 that introduced a
unittest, which is supposed to work with eventlet.  The patch lacks
monkey_patching hence when running the test with eventlet installed, it
gets stuck forever because time.sleep is not patched by eventlet and
thus doesn't yield.

Change-Id: Iedf25109bd07a2415e44e84f74351dc45337e2b1
Related-bug: #1793499

commit_message:
ut: Use monkey_patch when running with eventlet

ovsdbapp doesn't have a dependency on eventlet and should work without
the library.  However, OpenStack uses eventlet heavily therefore it's
good to have support for that as well.  This patch is a follow up to
commit 9c07fe8310bec8939cde99018d10482a7c820b61 that introduced a
unittest, which is supposed to work with eventlet.  The patch lacks
monkey_patching hence when running the test with eventlet installed, it
gets stuck forever because time.sleep is not patched by eventlet and
thus doesn't yield.

Change-Id: Ia6b281a2656ee43e30ff7d7174dd05f5cf8fb525
Related-bug: #1793499

commit_message:
Revert "Use dd conv=sparse when writing images to nodes"

When using volumes, and having empty ones, the volumes are failing to
mount when using conv=sparse with dd . This is causing security
hardened volumes :
http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tripleo-image-elements/tree/elements/overcloud-secure/block-device-default.yaml

To fail when mounted via iscsi

This reverts commit ab0492a364b8d5ed20948e4de67f03dacaa3c38d.

Story: #2003755
Task: #26441
Change-Id: I03f53a50ada9aabe9e3fbb71106d5190ae110e01
(cherry picked from commit 3234f432e80180c6c5a95492b5ec8f7987ff3906)

commit_message:
ut: monkey patch threading test if eventlet is installed

If eventlet is installed (which is not a requirement for ovsdbapp),
the threading test will make use of eventlet and will monkey patch
the required modules. In order to not affect the rest of the tests,
it'll undo the monkey patching after its execution.

This test is particularly useful within the context of OpenStack where
eventlet is used in combination with ovsdbapp.

Change-Id: Ice725cb8182cdd18ffc9b19a6c7709377c5386d0
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I284d1722b7b525dd992263bb471a0dcbb36399a2
Story: #2002586
Task: #24297

commit_message:
Fix heat multi-region support with shared keystone

keystone endpoint region can be different from other services.
Let's use the one from keystone middleware authtoken config,
if available, when creating keystone client.

Change-Id: I190abd946db1cf8712ef669cf72a1134dfcf9376
Story: #2003806
Task: 26549

commit_message:
Default tempest jobs to Python3

This patch is changing the default Python interpreter in the tempest
jobs to Python3, affecting the following playbooks:

* tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-master
* tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-relase

The patch also introduces a new python2 tempest job running against the
released version of OVS for testing backward compatibility with the old
python interpreter.

There was a tempest-dsvm-networking-ovn-ovs-master-python3 job
definition that ran in the experiemental gate pipeline that has been
deleted as part of this change as well. We don't need it anymore.

Change-Id: Ifc053c03ad08dd373d7dc0afadf860c848b386c9

commit_message:
Accepts option for conv flags in dd command

When using dd command, it may be needed to specify conversion
options, such as sparse for optimization. This change allows to
accept this option, in preparation for ironic to sent it when
enabled on configuration.

Change-Id: I166abbf513557a836de3cce4fc9ea6b7fedbb562
Story: #2003755
Task: #26443

commit_message:
Remove unused conf opts

The advent of a working 'tox -egenconfig' makes it easy to
determine which conf opts from nova are not being used by
placement.

This change gets most of them, but leaves out opt removals
provided by change I91361ea31c015542be52f905d75d2ca53c61103f

Change-Id: I070d26faebeca4aa803a1cbf85e5f17a1149cf74

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ia058d9eb871a63b3a3d6355ce226a353064f47bf

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I2d7496d4d4fd4c8d10a355246fc5d5b26bd14d52
(cherry picked from commit 6b4c0199182150df5ba0d850510efbfb512bf7ff)

commit_message:
Drop SELinux support for CentOS 7

We do not have a maintainer at the moment for SELinux and hopefully
we will adopt the upstream openstack-selinux package, but for now
in order to let deploys in environments where SELinux is set to
permissive work, we'll have to remove these bits.

This change can be reverted whenever we have a maintainer that's
available to do the work required.

Closes-Bug: 1792050
Change-Id: I4c7b6a9c0d8ec1458a9396422d047e1327bb4d45
(cherry picked from commit 084559b8cf7c7fe2b7e6a530e6f6da804d38e056)

commit_message:
Fix stable/rocky CI

This is a combination of 4 commits.

Commit #1
=========

Update .gitreview for stable/rocky

Commit #2
=========

Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/rocky

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Commit #3
=========

Get ceilometer from pypi

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/603288/
(cherry picked from commit c2b386c1dd49f8e300d6ad8aa8a6f0cec897ecd7)

=========

Fix PEP8 tox environment

It has checks for documentation however it was missing the documentation
requirements.

This patch adds doc/requirements.txt as a source for pip packages.

(cherry picked from commit 79a6cb667235490e42f0d0ba25b472b07d94b3af)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-12 14:32:30.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "pseudo port binding: teach agent aliveness"

This reverts commit fff0a81acb664f1cafc054404f962ec8723232b0.

During scale tests we saw that neutron agent aliveness mechanism is not
working properly and was marking agents as down and thus failing on port
binding. We assessed that aliveness in our context is not actually
interesting, as we only use the agentdb mechanism to store the
information we need for port binding.

As a result of this assessment we decided to remove the aliveness
awareness from the code and try to bind the port disregarding that. The
consequence of this is that a "neutron agent-list" call might show the
agent as dead or alive but that's not information we should depend on to
understand if we are binding to that node.

Change-Id: I66319f9689591a35a1fbca5f493faa41066dd067
(cherry picked from commit 0f3ddd36613f025549dd253452d7a6e3644402b7)

commit_message:
Revert "pseudo port binding: teach agent aliveness"

This reverts commit fff0a81acb664f1cafc054404f962ec8723232b0.

During scale tests we saw that neutron agent aliveness mechanism is not
working properly and was marking agents as down and thus failing on port
binding. We assessed that aliveness in our context is not actually
interesting, as we only use the agentdb mechanism to store the
information we need for port binding.

As a result of this assessment we decided to remove the aliveness
awareness from the code and try to bind the port disregarding that. The
consequence of this is that a "neutron agent-list" call might show the
agent as dead or alive but that's not information we should depend on to
understand if we are binding to that node.

Change-Id: I66319f9689591a35a1fbca5f493faa41066dd067
(cherry picked from commit 0f3ddd36613f025549dd253452d7a6e3644402b7)

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
3. We promote the jobs which appear to be reliably working.
4. We rename the tox target for 'func_ovs' to 'ovs' as the
   'func_' prefix is pointless.
5. We rename the '-nv' jobs to without that suffix, and move
   the non-voting argument to the projects file to make it
   more obvious and easier to change later.

Change-Id: Ic2f8a999cc084da76fade0000d2e6198b025c38a
(cherry picked from commit 2c847b53cbbaee5801c549c98b160f9b8c7786ae)

commit_message:
Fix Dockerfile for support mysql and postgres

This patch set adds pymysql and psycopg2 to the Dockerfile so that
you can use mysql and postgres in the rally-openstack docker image.

Change-Id: I68814bd7bdc92975b8c60db18e1688326c4e4dad
Closes-Bug: #1793087

commit_message:
playbooks: roles: Do not force dependency upgrades

pip >= 10 is very strict when it comes to satisfying dependency
requirements. If python-foo is installed from the distro repos but
a higher version is available in pypi, then pip will try to upgrade the
package and fail with the following error:

 It is a distutils installed project and thus we cannot accurately determine
 which files belong to it which would lead to only a partial uninstall.

As such, lets make pip less aggressive by allowing existing packages to
satisfy dependency requirements.

Change-Id: I3a28abd4a68676fda180694a030ea40c7552d8d2

commit_message:
bifrost-create-vm-nodes: Add missing g++ dependency for virtualbmc

The virtualbmc package needs g++ for compliation otherwise it fails with
the following error:

gcc: error trying to exec 'cc1plus': execvp: No such file or directory

Change-Id: Ie626ba3327504ded2cbcbf622122c25303022341

commit_message:
Re-add revision number check at update_router_port()

The OVS command checking the router port revision number was
accidentally removed from the update_router_port() method. This patch is
re-adding it.

Change-Id: I4ce8f9219afdcf5c74dad144ce05af9dba283d07
Closes-Bug: #1792593

subject: Clean up role tests
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 20:09:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-19 20:09:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-09-20 06:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-21 09:43:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 20:09:00.000000000', 'message': "Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it. The associated
   scripts are also removed.
2. We remove the 'pypy' tox target. The job was removed some
   time ago, but the tox target left behind. The associated
   inventory is also removed.
3. We remove the 'multireg' jobs. The jobs have been failing
   for some time and are very complex. If multi-region tests
   are re-implemented, they should be done in a simpler way -
   probably best using multiple nodes, rather than trying to
   fudge it on a single host with containers. The associated
   scripts and inventory items are also removed.
4. We rename the 'func_swift3' tox target to 'swift3', and
   reconfigure the job appropriately. The verbose logging for
   ansible is also removed, given that we have ARA to provide
   decent diagnostic output.

Change-Id: I411fcaac9a1ddf17996d771f13b2de7e775e4a60
(cherry picked from commit 386cdb51e20581d781df800d785c35a488f5d4c7)

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it. The associated
   scripts are also removed.
2. We remove the 'pypy' tox target. The job was removed some
   time ago, but the tox target left behind. The associated
   inventory is also removed.
3. We remove the 'multireg' jobs. The jobs have been failing
   for some time and are very complex. If multi-region tests
   are re-implemented, they should be done in a simpler way -
   probably best using multiple nodes, rather than trying to
   fudge it on a single host with containers. The associated
   scripts and inventory items are also removed.

Change-Id: I411fcaac9a1ddf17996d771f13b2de7e775e4a60
(cherry picked from commit 386cdb51e20581d781df800d785c35a488f5d4c7)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Idc39d9df54afbe37a1fdca90655af541abf2cc4a
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it. The associated
   scripts are also removed.
2. We remove the 'pypy' tox target. The job was removed some
   time ago, but the tox target left behind. The associated
   inventory is also removed.
3. We remove the 'multireg' jobs. The jobs have been failing
   for some time and are very complex. If multi-region tests
   are re-implemented, they should be done in a simpler way -
   probably best using multiple nodes, rather than trying to
   fudge it on a single host with containers. The associated
   scripts and inventory items are also removed.
4. We rename the 'func_swift3' tox target to 'swift3', and
   reconfigure the job appropriately. The verbose logging for
   ansible is also removed, given that we have ARA to provide
   decent diagnostic output.

Change-Id: I411fcaac9a1ddf17996d771f13b2de7e775e4a60
(cherry picked from commit 386cdb51e20581d781df800d785c35a488f5d4c7)

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Ide6a83f980565af9cedb22e0ededaa2dea3487c6
(cherry picked from commit 3b829ec3a3f4709f1494fa211a95f2aa75caa179)

commit_message:
Fix missing specifying doctrees directory

In tox.ini file, the doctrees directory is specified
as an argument of sphinx-build command in api-ref,
releasenotes targets.
But it is missing in docs. So add it.

TrivialFix
Change-Id: I767b675b503cd627e80c7c1ff434d4a8ad53203a

commit_message:
Reduce number of installed packages for CentOS

- gcc is not needed in all hosts (only wheel builders)
- yum-plugin-priorities is no longer used because we don't
  use priorities

Change-Id: Ic6243a9fa4f55d0b256bdc503a4fcacfd962c642
(cherry picked from commit a7fe148e2bf1a73fd5fbb8c520deab4b00f753f1)

'}, {'created': '2018-09-07 10:19:54.000000000', 'message': 'py3: Switch to using Python 3 for rocky or later

Switch package install to Python 3 for OpenStack Rocky or later.

When upgrading, remove any python-* packages that where explicitly
installated and then autoremove --purge any dependencies that are
no longer required.

This change also switches to using the cinder-manage binary in
preference to using the internal API of Cinder to query and manage

commit_message:
py3: Switch to using Python 3 for rocky or later

Switch package install to Python 3 for OpenStack Rocky or later.

When upgrading, remove any python-* packages that where explicitly
installated and then autoremove --purge any dependencies that are
no longer required.

This change also switches to using the cinder-manage binary in
preference to using the internal API of Cinder to query and manage
services in cinder, avoiding the need to continue to have python-cinder
installed for charm usage.

Change-Id: Ie8f7d2d7e1ef7b3065d6d9ed244e5fd05e2f613b

commit_message:
py3: Enable Python 3 at Rocky

Misc updates for rocky:

  - Switch default smoke test to bionic-rocky
  - Resync charm helpers

The change for this charm is minimal as it directly uses
ceph-common.  The cinder charm actually deals with installation
of the required python-rados/rbd libraries for the ceph
integration.

Change-Id: Ic2ee4b845ab604d80b7e27492f522d57f9463af1

commit_message:
py3: Switch to Python 3 at Rocky

Misc updates to support the switch to Python 3 for Rocky:

  - Change default smoke test target to bionic-rocky
  - Resync charm helpers

Charm does not directly install any python packages, so
cinder charm will deal with upgrade and switch to py3.

Change-Id: I77d412a62f4a5362c7221b869f4f9c03d5d87737

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-22 15:51:07.000000000', 'message': "Parse dhcp leases file in a more robust way

It turns out that in environments with a big number of VMs, sometimes
the neutron dhcp agent fails to read the dhcp lease file because some
lines with the ipv4/ipv6 entries don't have enough fields and causes the
dhcp agent to fail.

When this happens the agent calls sync_state to
fully resync the agent state, that causes a serious performance problems
in scale environments.

Change-Id: Ia681a5e929df5bf8c97ae9445876c306c34061b5
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>
"}, {'created': '2018-08-23 07:02:32.000000000', 'message': "Parse dhcp leases file in a more robust way

the neutron dhcp agent fails to read the dhcp lease file because some
lines with the ipv4/ipv6 entries don't have enough fields and causes the
dhcp agent to fail.

When this happens the agent calls sync_state to
fully resync the agent state, that causes a serious performance problems
in scale environments.

We need to be more robust reading the file to handle these exceptions.

Partial-Bug: #1788556

Change-Id: Ia681a5e929df5bf8c97ae9445876c306c34061b5
Signed-off-by: aojeagarcia <aojeagarcia@suse.com>

commit_message:
Parse dhcp leases file in a more robust way

It turns out that in environments with a big number of VMs, sometimes
the neutron dhcp agent fails to read the dhcp lease file because some
lines with the ipv4/ipv6 entries don't have enough fields and causes the
dhcp agent to fail.

When this happens the agent calls sync_state to
fully resync the agent state, that causes a serious performance problems
in scale environments.

We need to be more robust reading the file to handle these exceptions.

Co-authored-by: stephen-ma
Partial-Bug: #1788556

Change-Id: Ia681a5e929df5bf8c97ae9445876c306c34061b5

commit_message:
Switch grenade job to wsgi

Now that grenade is using Rocky as its base we
can switch to WSGI for ir-api. Also now required
for CI as IRONIC_USE_WSGI was getting flipflopped
from False -> True -> False during the grenade job.

Change-Id: Ief6c7dbe70dbe10885d74a030bc820b2a54cc2ac

messages: [{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-09-19 17:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-09-19 17:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-09-21 09:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 17:16:36.000000000', 'message': "Don't reverse series list in new_release

The list is already sorted such that the order is stein, rocky,
queens, etc. If we reverse it and then look at only everything after
and including stein, we get no results unless there has been a stein
release.

The reversing was originally necessary because we were using
os.listdir to get the list of series, but now that we're reading them
from a yaml file that is already reverse sorted we don't need that.
See d3f7e4e1f5c860072a5da070f06498c0ad0aa160.

Change-Id: Id65de92f89dc02ba076a6b2dfb949a091cf4ce38
"}]
commit_message:
Don't reverse series list in new_release

The list is already sorted such that the order is stein, rocky,
queens, etc. If we reverse it and then look at only everything after
and including stein, we get no results unless there has been a stein
release.

The reversing was originally necessary because we were using
os.listdir to get the list of series, but now that we're reading them
from a yaml file that is already reverse sorted we don't need that.
See d3f7e4e1f5c860072a5da070f06498c0ad0aa160.

Change-Id: Id65de92f89dc02ba076a6b2dfb949a091cf4ce38

commit_message:
convert warning for missing repo to error

If a release does not include all of the repositories in the
deliverable report an error instead of a warning.

Change-Id: I7980b204995647fc77657123fa8d7bb565b55247
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-28 15:57:19.000000000', 'message': "clean up CUDA traits

There was a misunderstanding of what the CUDA traits really stood for.
This wasn't helped by the fact that the NVIDIA CUDA documentation and
versioning system is so awkward.

Basically, there's the CUDA Compute Capability version, which represents
the hardware GPU instruction set extensions supported by various NVIDIA
GPUs. And there is the CUDA SDK version which represents a window of
CUDA Compute Capability versions that the library is able to work with.

This patch adds a new os_traits.hw.gpu.cuda module with these new
traits. It removes the old os_traits.hw.gpu.api.CUDA* traits since those
were misleading and inaccurate.

It also adds a new utility function that maps CUDA SDK version to
supported CUDA Compute Capability versions that the SDK supports. This
support matrix information was taken from the CUDA wikipedia article
which lists the supported version information.

Change-Id: Id4adb6874615ad5f9f8aff780a83119e10a38c35

commit_message:
clean up CUDA traits

There was a misunderstanding of what the CUDA traits really stood for.
This wasn't helped by the fact that the NVIDIA CUDA documentation and
versioning system is so awkward.

Basically, there's the CUDA Compute Capability version, which represents
the hardware GPU instruction set extensions supported by various NVIDIA
GPUs. And there is the CUDA SDK version which represents a window of
CUDA Compute Capability versions that the library is able to work with.

This patch adds a new os_traits.hw.gpu.cuda module with these new
traits. It removes the old os_traits.hw.gpu.api.CUDA* traits since those
were misleading and inaccurate.

It also adds a new utility function that maps CUDA SDK version to
supported CUDA Compute Capability versions that the SDK supports. This
support matrix information was taken from the CUDA wikipedia article
which lists the supported version information.

Change-Id: Id4adb6874615ad5f9f8aff780a83119e10a38c35

subject: Remove octavia from functional tests
messages:
[{'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-04 07:19:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-07 06:46:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-10 06:48:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-09-12 23:31:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We just spoke with the Octavia team, and their devstack plugin can be configured to use no-op drivers. That seems like a great way to still test the API without relying on all of the downstream stuff (Nova, Neutron, &c.) that tends to break them.

There's a octavia-v2-dsvm-noop-api in Octavia that uses this that we can take as an example. The devstack config looks like:

  [controller_worker]
  amphora_driver = amphora_noop_driver
  compute_driver = compute_noop_driver
  network_driver = network_noop_driver"}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-09-17 16:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Patch here: I8765aceee09ada3086abc704b7f73ce240e21847

It seems to work at least some of the time. Not sure if the failures are due to something else being unstable in the gate.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-09-21 09:34:14.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

for now.

Change-Id: I16bb1a5633a60345942eb1a21794217273bfc00a
"}]
commit_message:
Remove octavia from functional tests

It's quite slow and the reason of many gate failures. Let's remove it
for now.

Change-Id: I16bb1a5633a60345942eb1a21794217273bfc00a

commit_message:
Use swiftUrl as a base for exported plan download URL

This changes the way the exported plan and logs download URL is generated.
The temporary url is parsed, path is stripped from API version
and AUTH parts and appended with search section to swiftUrl.

This ensures that generated URL is always accessible since it is based
on swiftUrl.

Story: 2001869
Task: 14323

Change-Id: I3961eba69cb910e0fb63ca763f301bfc4ba7c05c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 16:06:29.000000000', 'message': 'Add monasca user to Monasca thresh container

The monasca-thresh container is special in that inherits from
the Storm container so that it has access to the Storm client.
We could make monasca-base inherit from Storm, but it would
bloat the other Monasca images which may not run on the same
nodes as the Storm topology.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: Idd1703b72e45bb9d124e06a28738b18da0bc6918
'}]
commit_message:
Add monasca user to Monasca thresh container

The monasca-thresh container is special in that inherits from
the Storm container so that it has access to the Storm client.
We could make monasca-base inherit from Storm, but it would
bloat the other Monasca images which may not run on the same
nodes as the Storm topology.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-containers
Change-Id: Idd1703b72e45bb9d124e06a28738b18da0bc6918

[{'created': '2018-08-30 21:48:57.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Fix revert-to-snapshot

Commit 46b8da35d79121df34ec9befd353c8c428be846b modified
the method we use to query the backend volumes. But,
revert-to-snapshot implementation which was in-progress
when the above commit was merged missed that change.
Fixing it by updating the query method call in
revert_to_snapshot.

Change-Id: I34cbd4420b43f52cd8d23833658f6386cb3e6437
Closes-bug: #1790008
'}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix revert-to-snapshot

Commit 46b8da35d79121df34ec9befd353c8c428be846b modified
the method we use to query the backend volumes. But,
revert-to-snapshot implementation which was in-progress
when the above commit was merged missed that change.
Fixing it by updating the query method call in
revert_to_snapshot.

Change-Id: I34cbd4420b43f52cd8d23833658f6386cb3e6437
Closes-bug: #1790008

[{'created': '2018-08-30 19:33:56.000000000', 'message': 'VMware: Remove member initialization in properties

Currently we initialize few driver member variables in properties.
When osprofiler is enabled, the driver class is inspected which

commit_message:
VMware: Remove member initialization in properties

Currently we initialize few driver member variables in properties.
When osprofiler is enabled, the driver class is inspected which
results in the initialization of those variables. The same variables
including session are re-initialized during driver setup. Removing
variable initialization in properties to fix this.

Change-Id: I071e55b0a86848250565ada3a22ce4225b266540

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-06 15:07:56.000000000', 'message': 'Configure placement DB context manager for nova-manage/status

The create_incomplete_consumers online data migration was added in
Rocky via change Id609789ef6b4a4c745550cde80dd49cabe03869a. That
relies on hitting some tables in the API (or placement) database.
The DB API code for that migration relies on a placement context
manager which looks like it was regressed with change
I2fff528060ec52a4a2e26a6484bdf18359b95f77 (also in Rocky). This
results in a DB error trying to query the projects table but
because of a generic try/except in _run_migration, the failure
was missed in CI testing.

Similarly, the nova-status upgrade check "_check_resource_providers"
routine also uses the placement DB API context manager to count the
number of compute resource providers in the API (or placement) DB,
which is returning 0 because it's not using the proper DB connection.
This was not caught in the nova-status CLI tests because they use
the DatabaseFixture which *does* configure the global placement DB
API context manager.

This adds the configuration of the global placement DB API context
manager so we can properly query the placement-related tables.
The blanket problematic try/except from _run_migration is left
as-is in this change but will be addressed in a separate patch.

Integration testing of this fix is being performed with devstack:

  https://review.openstack.org/599847/

Change-Id: I9d97b7a904e2b7d15c763e2a067cc5909cc6c9c5
Closes-Bug: #1790701
Closes-Bug: #1790721
(cherry picked from commit 63c10d2d536c3ffed68ccfb6bd393f317111d903)
'}]
commit_message:
Configure placement DB context manager for nova-manage/status

The create_incomplete_consumers online data migration was added in
Rocky via change Id609789ef6b4a4c745550cde80dd49cabe03869a. That
relies on hitting some tables in the API (or placement) database.
The DB API code for that migration relies on a placement context
manager which looks like it was regressed with change
I2fff528060ec52a4a2e26a6484bdf18359b95f77 (also in Rocky). This
results in a DB error trying to query the projects table but
because of a generic try/except in _run_migration, the failure
was missed in CI testing.

Similarly, the nova-status upgrade check "_check_resource_providers"
routine also uses the placement DB API context manager to count the
number of compute resource providers in the API (or placement) DB,
which is returning 0 because it's not using the proper DB connection.
This was not caught in the nova-status CLI tests because they use
the DatabaseFixture which *does* configure the global placement DB
API context manager.

This adds the configuration of the global placement DB API context
manager so we can properly query the placement-related tables.
The blanket problematic try/except from _run_migration is left
as-is in this change but will be addressed in a separate patch.

Integration testing of this fix is being performed with devstack:

  https://review.openstack.org/599847/

Change-Id: I9d97b7a904e2b7d15c763e2a067cc5909cc6c9c5
Closes-Bug: #1790701
Closes-Bug: #1790721
(cherry picked from commit 63c10d2d536c3ffed68ccfb6bd393f317111d903)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-31 20:17:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix image-defined numa claims during evacuate

When evacuating, the API does not send the image_ref
to the compute so currently the compute manager
rebuild_instance() method will just pass an empty
dict for image_meta to the rebuild_claim, which means
if the server was originally created with an image that
has numa-related constraints, like hw_numa_nodes, those
constraints would not be applied to the destination host
during the evacuate.

This change simply checks for evacuate if image_ref is
not provided and pulls the image_meta off the instance
which was stashed in the instance.system_metadata during
server create (see get_system_metadata_from_image usage
in the compute API).

This fix was ported from the starlingx-staging/stx-nova
repo commit 71acfeae0.

Change-Id: If548fa3436174b1eae08cdcf6578020cc0c7b81f
Closes-Bug: #1785318
(cherry picked from commit 665ba461f3135857034cf33dd5f427d47fdd155e)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix image-defined numa claims during evacuate

When evacuating, the API does not send the image_ref
to the compute so currently the compute manager
rebuild_instance() method will just pass an empty
dict for image_meta to the rebuild_claim, which means
if the server was originally created with an image that
has numa-related constraints, like hw_numa_nodes, those
constraints would not be applied to the destination host
during the evacuate.

This change simply checks for evacuate if image_ref is
not provided and pulls the image_meta off the instance
which was stashed in the instance.system_metadata during
server create (see get_system_metadata_from_image usage
in the compute API).

This fix was ported from the starlingx-staging/stx-nova
repo commit 71acfeae0.

Change-Id: If548fa3436174b1eae08cdcf6578020cc0c7b81f
Closes-Bug: #1785318
(cherry picked from commit 665ba461f3135857034cf33dd5f427d47fdd155e)

why was the bandit broken?'}, {'account_id': 27882, 'date': '2018-09-05 12:37:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Ying Wang: it was already merged in master (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/592651/); but to answer your question: in the newest release of bandit some tests were removed / deprecated, which caused the failure of all test runs (pep8 env failed).

As far as I saw, there were different solutions for that in all OpenStack projects, e.g. in Neutron the bandit config was updated, in Octavia #nosec annotations were added in the code directly, etc. 

And here the bandit tests were just removed.'}, {'account_id': 24005, 'date': '2018-09-10 06:53:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

[{'created': '2018-09-19 20:05:48.000000000', 'message': "Mark some slow tests as slow so they move out of the main job

We've seen a trend of tempest-full jobs timing out because of
tests takinga long time to complete which are not marked slow:

  http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Based on some analysis of the slowest tests:

  https://ethercalc.openstack.org/dorupfz6s9qt

This change marks several tests as slow and gives reasons why
they are marked as slow - not only because they are slow, but
also because they are less common scenarios. These will still
be run in the tempest-slow job so we aren't losing test coverage
with this change.

If this makes the tempest-slow job itself take significantly
longer, we should consider running the tempest.api* slow tests
concurrently (like they are in tempest-full) and continue to
run the tempest.scenario* tests in serial. The tempest-slow job
currently runs all slow tests in serial, so this will make the
job take longer.

Change-Id: I2a0e154ba38c7407b41b7e986a0bf9b451c65cae

commit_message:
Mark some slow tests as slow so they move out of the main job

We've seen a trend of tempest-full jobs timing out because of
tests taking a long time to complete which are not marked slow:

  http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/#1783405

Based on some analysis of the slowest tests:

  https://ethercalc.openstack.org/dorupfz6s9qt

This change marks several tests as slow and gives reasons why
they are marked as slow - not only because they are slow, but
also because they are less common scenarios. These will still
be run in the tempest-slow job so we aren't losing test coverage
with this change.

If this makes the tempest-slow job itself take significantly
longer, we should consider running the tempest.api* slow tests
concurrently (like they are in tempest-full) and continue to
run the tempest.scenario* tests in serial. The tempest-slow job
currently runs all slow tests in serial, so this will make the
job take longer.

Partial-Bug: #1783405

Change-Id: I2a0e154ba38c7407b41b7e986a0bf9b451c65cae

Previously, if create_transaction() was called from different threads or
greenthreads, always a single transaction was returned even when the
thread was different.

This patch makes a map between thread ID and a transaction therefore

commit_message:
Make nested transaction thread aware

Previously, if create_transaction() was called from different threads or
greenthreads, always a single transaction was returned even when the
thread was different.

This patch makes a map between thread ID and a transaction therefore
nested transaction is returned only for the same threads.

Change-Id: I884e7973d05434d798e0aeaa0f1f826905a8113e
Closes-bug: 1793499
Closes-bug: 1735154

'}, {'created': '2018-08-21 16:05:59.000000000', 'message': 'Minimal(ist) network config for nspawn gating

Nspawn containers can attach directly to the physical host interface
using macvlan which allows us to greatly simplify connectivity in test
instances.

Changes to the user variable files have been made to allow the services
to function on a simplified stack.

The /etc/ansible directory will now be a bind mount within the
containers making it possible for the localfacts to be shared. This
limits reads and writes to the same file across containers.

Depends-On: I93bdfde1aa5a9820d1853a779caf6670ee58d335
Change-Id: Iaa7cfb051d26bcd080df15ef8949d3cf16208ea9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Minimal(ist) network config for nspawn gating

Nspawn containers can attach directly to the physical host interface
using macvlan which allows us to greatly simplify connectivity in test
instances.

Changes to the user variable files have been made to allow the services
to function on a simplified stack.

Depends-On: I083042a791d9213b9b1872a239dc18dc6c7ae46e
Change-Id: Iaa7cfb051d26bcd080df15ef8949d3cf16208ea9
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
py3: Switch to using Python 3 for rocky or later

Switch package install to Python 3 for OpenStack Rocky or later.

When upgrading, remove any python-* packages that where explicitly
installated and then autoremove --purge any dependencies that are
no longer required.

Change-Id: I120ed44988f9e86a27f464dc879acdc1b8926dd8

commit_message:
Make validation-errors-nonfatal option available for FFU.

This makes the tripleo_upgrade_validations_non_fatal work like in the
upgrade.

This should be set in the featureset if required.

Change-Id: I9c31ead304ab58ffe0b6428a3003fef4c4578d44

GATE CHECK for TripleO

This change is used to check the health of our stable branch gate jobs
in the most direct way possible, by running the real gates on a noop
change.

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I8e15ffe03d1a57bcc5b2f8be36e4a6d6e6bf27a2
(cherry picked from commit 1c3b303208be43ee9c6432daba4a807ccfb1d93c)

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Id5aaeb02772f9925510e712c2e8a90df6d96955a
(cherry picked from commit 0812140e0fc355643c51a6e809e9bbf4dee42b25)

i see some scenario tests are repeated from tempest full like tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps. is there any plan to modify expression of existing job so that tests aren't repeated ? if yes please add a note in commit message. otherwise patch looks okay but running tests repeatedly over different jobs is just a waste IMO !"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-08-15 20:02:19.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review+2 by Slawek Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>
'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-08-22 07:01:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> i see some scenario tests are repeated from tempest full like
 > tempest.scenario.test_network_basic_ops.TestNetworkBasicOps. is
 > there any plan to modify expression of existing job so that tests
 > aren't repeated ? if yes please add a note in commit message.
 > otherwise patch looks okay but running tests repeatedly over
 > different jobs is just a waste IMO !

There cannot be any duplicate test running. tempest-full exclude the 'slow' test[1] and tempest-slow runs only 'slow' tests[2].

You can see in job run - where test_network_basic_ops.py has total 10 tests[3] from which 2 (non slow tests) are run in tempest-full [4] and remaining 8 (slow tests) are run in tempest-slow[5]. 

tempest-slow is defined specially not to run any duplicate tests. 

[1] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/60f8dfc708161b63be677dcecc6824aa1cff211c/tox.ini#L83
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/60f8dfc708161b63be677dcecc6824aa1cff211c/tox.ini#L146
[3] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/60f8dfc708161b63be677dcecc6824aa1cff211c/tempest/scenario/test_network_basic_ops.py

[4] http://logs.openstack.org/47/583847/2/check/tempest-full/dbab076/testr_results.html.gz

[{'created': '2018-07-19 04:33:43.000000000', 'message': 'Use Tempest scenario job to run all scenario tests

Tempest has migrated the scenario job in Tempest
tree and renamed it to "tempest-scenario-all".[1]

This job runs all the Tempest scenario tests including
slow tests. By running this job will help to avoid any
regressions across projects.

This new job "tempest-scenario-all" will run as voting on check pipeline
same as proposed in nova[2] and cinder[3].

Tempest also run "tempest-scenario-all" as voting job.

Detailed discussion on ML[4].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n147
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583840/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/583842/
[4] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

commit_message:
Use Tempest slow job to run all slow tests

tempest-slow job run all the slow tests including API
or scenario slow tests. By running this job will help to
avoid any regressions across projects.

This new job "tempest-slow" will run as voting on check pipeline
and same job run on nova and cinder gate.

Tempest also run "tempest-slow" as voting job.

Detailed discussion on ML[2].

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/tempest/tree/.zuul.yaml#n147
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-May/130394.html

Change-Id: Icdf5578234a96fa36e4b275d70f943da059a4b1e

commit_message:
Use templates for cover and lower-constraints

Use openstack-tox-cover template, this runs the cover job
in the check queue only.

Use openstack-lower-constraints-jobs template.

Remove jobs that are part of the templates.

Change-Id: Ieada5c2ee82497f4d6f07338df4577398d044fb6

* remove unused files

subject: Remove validations in undercloud reinstall.
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Ji Strnsk', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 13861, 'name': 'yatin', 'email': 'ykarel@redhat.com', 'username': 'yatinkarel'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 18846, 'name': 'RedHat RDO CI', 'email': 'rdo-ci-admins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdo-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27898, 'name': 'Quique Llorente', 'email': 'ellorent@redhat.com', 'username': 'quiquell'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-09-19 09:43:47.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:37:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:55:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Correct fix is https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603523/'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:03:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:06:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Disabling validations is not the correct fix for this.  Safe or not, we'd need to address the diskspace and not just hide the problem.  What happens when we ignore this and run out of space sometimes when downloading containers and not other times? It'll make it really hard to troubleshoot."}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:15:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Ok that's fair. I have a patch to lower the requirement to 20 G here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603063/  Or do we want to make sure we get bigger nodes from OS infra?"}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:18:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I don't think we can get larger nodes, perhaps we need to do some cleaning up of what we have. I find it kinda odd that we only have 25g free.  I thought these were 80g nodes"}, {'account_id': 13861, 'date': '2018-09-19 15:01:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> I don't think we can get larger nodes, perhaps we need to do some
 > cleaning up of what we have. I find it kinda odd that we only have
 > 25g free.  I thought these were 80g nodes

looking at the validation part iiuc, validation is done to do some check prior to doing an operation(like install, reinstall, upgrade etc)
For install:- setting 25GB minimum means the node on which undercloud is installed should have 25GB, once undercloud is installed, it definitely consumes some disk and since now we have containers it consumes more compared to earlier releases.
but currently same requirements are validated for reinstall(it's different operation then install so atleast should have some different validations)
i think undercloud reinstall is idempotent so should not consume disk(apart from logging) and if it even consumes should not need 25GB. So at this phase should only validate those things which are required for this step(undercloud reinstall). I am not saying this remove validations for reinstall is correct, but currently what's done seems wrong to me. If i misunderstood some part, please correct me."}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-09-19 15:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

It's also triggered on updates/upgrades. I guess it might make sense to disable it on updates.  Not sure about upgrades though"}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-09-19 15:14:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

The pre-upgrade validation is different though, it checks for 20 G free, so maybe we should switch the pre-deploy validation to 20 G too, so that we can re-run the deploy? That's what i was thinking when i submitted https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603063/ . Not sure how else we can easily get out of this."}, {'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2018-09-21 06:48:22.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fixed in : https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603523/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 09:43:47.000000000', 'message': 'Remove validations in undercloud reinstall.

To validate the undercloud installation a
task which re-runs the installation is executed
to check the idempotency. As the undercloud was
previously installed, the available space might
be under the threshold specified by the undercloud
install validations. For that reason, this patch
disables the validations when re-installing the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I44718fe5bd6690531f4579317a2f0ccede10d999
Closes-Bug: #1793281
'}, {'created': '2018-09-19 13:37:07.000000000', 'message': 'Remove validations in undercloud reinstall.

To validate the undercloud installation a
task which re-runs the installation is executed
to check the idempotency. As the undercloud was
previously installed, the available space might
be under the threshold specified by the undercloud
install validations. For that reason, this patch
disables the validations when re-installing the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I44718fe5bd6690531f4579317a2f0ccede10d999
Closes-Bug: #1793281
'}]
commit_message:
Remove validations in undercloud reinstall.

To validate the undercloud installation a
task which re-runs the installation is executed
to check the idempotency. As the undercloud was
previously installed, the available space might
be under the threshold specified by the undercloud
install validations. For that reason, this patch
disables the validations when re-installing the
undercloud.

Change-Id: I44718fe5bd6690531f4579317a2f0ccede10d999
Closes-Bug: #1793281

commit_message:
Remove ha-guide docs to avoid conflict

The ha-guide repo is being restored and owned by the Operations
Documentation SIG. Until the openstack-manuals content is removed,
patches merged to either repo will overwrite the content of the web
site.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603219/

Change-Id: Iabd74139d1d73016563d0cfd30cf8ed6a3e1fc57
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
WIP: Remove inclusion of legacy playbook in tripleo-ci-base

Legacy zuul-cloner and subnode definitions
should no longer be required in zuul v3
work. subnodes should be picked up via the
inventory.

commit_message:
Replace assertEqual(True/False, expr) with assertTrue/assertFalse in tests

In some cases, If the result of expr is a boolen value, we shoud use
assertTrue/assertFalse to instead. Beacause it is clear and simple.

Change-Id: Ie61369f6335a90b09bb24192282d33da5272c13f
Story: #2003785
Task: #26490

[{'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:02:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 04:54:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-20 06:35:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/584217/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 40m 38s'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 14:05:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck unrelated test_extend_attached_volume failure'}, {'account_id': 26622, 'date': '2018-07-20 15:41:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

- neutron http://cloudbase-ci.com/neutron/584217/2 : SUCCESS in 1h 31m 35s'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-20 16:26:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Since this is effectively changing the access to the service_types shouldn't we also make mention of such in the neutron API reference [1]. The API ref code lives in neutron-lib.



[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#subnet-service-types-extension"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 17:46:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Since this is effectively changing the access to the service_types
 > shouldn't we also make mention of such in the neutron API reference
 > [1]. The API ref code lives in neutron-lib.
 > 
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#subnet-service-types-extension

Thanks, for the review. I have a few questions regarding this change, assuming you agree it's valid:

* should I file a bug for this in launchpad for this? Wasn't sure if this required tagging it as a security defect.
* would this need to be cherry-picked into ocata/pike releases if it's merged for master?"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 17:51:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Since this is effectively changing the access to the service_types
 > shouldn't we also make mention of such in the neutron API reference
 > [1]. The API ref code lives in neutron-lib.
 > 
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/network/v2/#subnet-service-types-extension

re: Make mention of it in api-ref. The api-ref already states: "Subnet service types extension (subnet-service-types) allows administrative users to set the desired port types for a subnet by adding the service_types attributes to subnets." So doesn't it already state that service_type plugin requires admin privileges, making this a bug fix rather than an actual change per se?

Also, I don't know if https://github.com/openstack/neutron-lib/blob/f52c6b46af31c0cc0eff01fd05f2dd1bb64e2726/neutron_lib/api/definitions/servicetype.py#L35 needs to be updated with enforce_policy: True either.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-20 17:53:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Will make updates, just want to make sure I don't need to make additional changes here before I respin the change."}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-07-25 14:47:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hoping a neutron core comes by to comment.
It seems if this is a valid bug/fix then it would need to be backported to queens/pike.


IMHO a bug report may have helped by allowing cores and/or folks triaging bugs to provide some initial direction/input.
You can also try just asking for a core to take a peek at this patch on the #openstack-neutron IRC channel.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-25 15:24:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Fix create/update subnet servicetype not enforcing policy

This patch set fixes create_subnet:service_types and
update_subnet:service_types policies not getting enforced
by oslo.policy even though both are admin_only in
the policy file [0].

This was caught initially using RBAC tests [1] and also
confirmed using unit tests.

The bug is fixed by adding 'enforce_policy': True to
the service_type extension.

Unit tests are added to prevent regression and validate
correct behavior.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/b16b890ec6067bd9ccca26e1312cb26d7f984ca9/etc/policy.json#L19
[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/582388

Partial-Bug: #1784259
Change-Id: Iaa6f57bd480148f047d102e222f4f71e93b417c5

can you link to what's wrong with docs-on-readthedocs?  is it being/can it be fixed?"}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2018-07-02 02:54:47.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> can you link to what's wrong with docs-on-readthedocs?  is it
 > being/can it be fixed?

Sure, I believe it can be fixed.

Here is the issue:

http://logs.openstack.org/36/3655659bb7bb1dc066e7c914e2362359d65b5d5b/post/trigger-readthedocs/5ee94c9/ara-report/

The API used by the docs-on-readthedocs template is deprecated and so RTD is raising a 403.

The issue has been corrected locally in Armada* and Deckhand [0] using job definition [1]. We have to pass the encrypted token to the API call to get it to work, so this is the only thing that I guess the new template Zuul-side would have to account for.

* Armada RTD admin page requires an update so the in-tree version will still fail as then, but it uses the same job definition as Deckhand, which passes.

[0] example of passing log: http://logs.openstack.org/59/59182380e3272fd28f9c21b2e7cdc784f7a36f74/post/airship-deckhand-doc-publish/9ee714f/ara-report/
[1] https://github.com/openstack/airship-deckhand/blob/master/tools/gate/playbooks/rtd-build-trigger.yaml"}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2018-07-02 04:57:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

well could we work on getting the main job working, it seems useful to everyone?

Thanks Andreas! Will do so when time permits'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-08-24 19:43:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I see now airship-deckhand having both docs-on-readthedocs and a airship-deckhand-doc-publish. Could you clean this up, please?

commit_message:
Drop docs-on-readthedocs from airship-armada

Armada currently is handling documentation publishing to
readthedocs in tree because the current template is buggy;
due to avoid duplication in publishing this is dropped for now.

Change-Id: I790b832bb32410efd76d001b28e4d92ef285ba19

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I28ff7b95d3b2cc064c59c9966e9c25c7ad9184da
(cherry picked from commit 939df557398f755b50116e0dad66032d4c2b1bb8)

[{'created': '2018-09-20 13:19:43.000000000', 'message': "SUSE: Switch distro jobs as voting

Roles are self contained so we know if a job should be passing or not.
The distro package jobs are fairly straightforward so it's good to know
that everything is working as it should and not ignore problems because
a job is non-voting.

Change-Id: Id8d1fbfd0f5cd1c51d183c20810db17a5e8ae8a7
"}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Switch distro jobs as voting

Roles are self contained so we know if a job should be passing or not.
The distro package jobs are fairly straightforward so it's good to know
that everything is working as it should and not ignore problems because
a job is non-voting.

Change-Id: Id8d1fbfd0f5cd1c51d183c20810db17a5e8ae8a7

commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7
(cherry picked from commit a98b2d366345a72adbafe440ee8f9f7b2f9c419d)

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Iacec416e781977307e99780ffec1f8c08dd58aca
(cherry picked from commit cfef027499cbadf7d56fb4de008f3429d85b1f0d)

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

Build succeeded.

- nova http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/603993/1 : SUCCESS in 2h 19m 44s'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-09-20 13:57:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The bits you're changing here aren't actually instances of what's mentioned in the bug/guideline. Deferring translation/interpolation only helps when logging, because the logging translation macros (_L*) only interpret the variables if the relevant log level is active. And in the case of variables which are exceptions, removing six.text_type() only works because those macros do it for you (if they're activated).

In contrast, the examples in this patch are doing immediate interpolation (via `%`), so a) there's no opportunity for deferral, and b) six.text_type() is necessary to stringify the exceptions because implicit stringification ("%s" % non_string_var) doesn't always work.'}, {'account_id': 25284, 'date': '2018-09-21 01:22:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> The bits you're changing here aren't actually instances of what's
 > mentioned in the bug/guideline. Deferring translation/interpolation
 > only helps when logging, because the logging translation macros
 > (_L*) only interpret the variables if the relevant log level is
 > active. And in the case of variables which are exceptions, removing
 > six.text_type() only works because those macros do it for you (if
 > they're activated).
 > 
 > In contrast, the examples in this patch are doing immediate
 > interpolation (via `%`), so a) there's no opportunity for deferral,
 > and b) six.text_type() is necessary to stringify the exceptions
 > because implicit stringification ("%s" % non_string_var) doesn't
 > always work.

OKunderstand thank you'}, {'account_id': 25284, 'date': '2018-09-21 01:25:01.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7

commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7
(cherry picked from commit a98b2d366345a72adbafe440ee8f9f7b2f9c419d)

I'm not sure that I understand you.
In this specification describes only tosca-parser and heat-translator changes.

Current implementation of tosca-parser doesn't allow you to choose different implementation for different tosca_definitions_version"}, {'account_id': 28530, 'date': '2018-08-13 09:24:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 16511, 'date': '2018-08-17 02:57:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

This spec describes changes to projects outside of tacker, so it would probably be better to open Storyboard stories for heat-translator and tosca-parser.  The tosca-parser changes in particular are pretty extensive and will require a lot of review and tests.

tosca-parser has a change pending that will allow supporting multiple definition files using stevedore extensions, which should help.

I would recommend updating this spec to focus on the Tacker-specific changes with references to the dependencies on tosca-parser/heat-translator, and document those changes in the stories.'}, {'account_id': 28528, 'date': '2018-08-27 13:37:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
Upgrade TACKER To Support Latest TOSCA And NFV Simple Profiles

This specification describes changes of TOSCA-parser and Heat-translator
needed to be implemented to support actual drafts of Tosca Simple Profile
in YAML (includes profile for NFV) in Tacker.

Blueprint: latest-tosca-version-support

Change-Id: I3bcd98ad176e67b85ec0385ebb14f16467b54a96
