commit_message:
Add generic action code.

Add generic action code that utilises charms_openstack.bus.discover()
so that the top level charm does not need to make any changes to
inherit generic actions.

Change-Id: I8b3422b915e2477d936e5cdd2d883c6815487577

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.

Change-Id: I28ff7b95d3b2cc064c59c9966e9c25c7ad9184da
(cherry picked from commit 939df557398f755b50116e0dad66032d4c2b1bb8)

commit_message:
Improve Elasticsearch scenario

1. Use NovaScenario parent for Elasticserch scenario and use
_boot_server method for creating server instead of client method.

2. Add server_boot_kwargs args for custom server boot, for example for
defining custom nic.

3. Add action to check server indexed.

4. Add variability flag - search elasticsearch by id or name.

5. Add additional_query arg for better and clarified query results.

Change-Id: Ic889def63bb6e8f535ac9e1aeed9b4f19e6f8823

commit_message:
Add manage_memcache_package parameter

Adds a new parameter named manage_memcache_package that
can be used to set if we should install the python memcache
library if memcache caching is enabled.

Change-Id: I924f837afc756817c202637b1b7db83c125df1d8

this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
2. We rename the tox target for 'func_lxc' to 'lxc' and
   as the 'func_' prefix is pointless.
3. We remove the base python setting in the lxc tox target
   because we're not running our functional tests using py3
   yet.

Change-Id: Ie0e72f69026c44a3c3ff6316bbb308bdd873c149
(cherry picked from commit f6ab8c4a8af15caba9d73fbcce95d18a76514cfc)

commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'upgrade' job, given that it's been broken
   all cycle due to the way the job executes and we need to
   regroup to figure out another way to do it.
2. We rename the tox target for 'func_lxc' to 'lxc' and
   as the 'func_' prefix is pointless.
3. We remove the base python setting in the lxc tox target
   because we're not running our functional tests using py3
   yet.

Change-Id: Ie0e72f69026c44a3c3ff6316bbb308bdd873c149
(cherry picked from commit f6ab8c4a8af15caba9d73fbcce95d18a76514cfc)

commit_message:
Ensure package cache is updated for nspawn containers

Due to differences in the way the containers are created, the
package cache must be forcefully updated after creation. If
this is not done then apt thinks that it's up to date and
fails package installs.

We also ensure that the quota is rescanned to ensure that
it is up to date.

The playbook arrangement is also updated to standardise to
the same pattern as the others.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/593033
Change-Id: I44ea902b0785bdeec4565e926105d24fae18500f
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Use latest tag for ansible-resolvconf role

For some reason the upgrade tests are failing when trying to
checkout the SHA. Given that there is only one more commit in
the repo which is only to modify tests, we can use the latest
tag instead.

Change-Id: I1c95a9aec37fa3e11f609c0513d42a30a39a21a5

commit_message:
Update Volume Backup hint

Replace object storage service with cinder-backup drivers
(object service, Ceph, NFS, etc ...) as a suggestion for the improved
description.

This has to be merged to stable/rocky first'}, {'account_id': 27781, 'date': '2018-09-15 14:12:19.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2018-09-20 14:23:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Why abandon it? The patch is fine, but we can't merge it without merging *first* the backport in stable/rocky. That's part of the stable policy update:
https://docs.openstack.org/project-team-guide/stable-branches.html#appropriate-fixes

So please propose the patch for stable/rocky and then resurrect this."}]

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Icbcd324430a33060ac56e21d8d7487b2701d031e
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

commit_message:
VMware: Use vSphere template as snapshot format

Adding support for using vSphere template as a volume
snapshot format in vCenter server. The current format
(COW disk) does not allow snapshot of attached volumes
and this limitation is removed by the new template
format.

Change-Id: Id5dd71a785c4cd72ba44f9b4d26319be53079c39

commit_message:
file_perms: Skip rpm verification step for Leap 15

openSUSE Leap 15 has a bug in the sudo package and this test always
fails. As such, we need to skip it until the upstream bug is fixed.

Change-Id: Ifa6baa50d0e0c2e2cabba39ba101ef943f14d882
Link: https://bugzilla.suse.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1097643

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 06:20:58.000000000', 'message': 'Update .zuul.yaml

Some cleanups:
* Remove python3 variable from tox-docs, tox.ini is setup correctly; no
  need for this setting - and the docs-pti template uses tox.ini
* Use lower-constraints template instead of individual jobs
* Use cover template to run cover job in check instead of post queue.
* Sort template list alphabetically.

Change-Id: I6b77786007070794601c0b7d6262a4c2db8fbe0c
'}]
commit_message:
Update .zuul.yaml

Some cleanups:
* Remove python3 variable from tox-docs, tox.ini is setup correctly; no
  need for this setting - and the docs-pti template uses tox.ini
* Use lower-constraints template instead of individual jobs
* Use cover template to run cover job in check instead of post queue.
* Sort template list alphabetically.

Change-Id: I6b77786007070794601c0b7d6262a4c2db8fbe0c

commit_message:
Expose the endpoint_override parameter

After the deprecation of the parameters "service_url" from
group "inspector" and "api_url" from group "conductor", we need
to expose the "endpoint_override" in groups "inspector" and
"service_catalog"

Change-Id: Iae5d8913f64665327024841c2af709bea3c25b49

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-20 02:08:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-20 07:45:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2018-09-20 10:09:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-20 13:08:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 02:08:34.000000000', 'message': 'Remove tempest testing

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Change-Id: I0ae271d49ebe43bfcaeda82159ec03ad6a82accd
'}]
commit_message:
Remove tempest testing

The stable/ocata branches are now in extended maintenance, so we
no longer expect to do releases from them. The tempest tests are
somewhat broken at this time, and this old code is difficult to
troubleshoot to fix it. As such, we remove the tempest tests,
leaving only a convergence test and rely on anyone still using
the old branch to resolve issues as they come up.

Change-Id: I0ae271d49ebe43bfcaeda82159ec03ad6a82accd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 19:34:49.000000000', 'message': "Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'ssl' job, given that the person working on
   that is no longer doing so, and no-one else has picked up
   the work.
2. We remove the 'func_base' and 'func_log'. They are unused
   relics of the past.

Change-Id: I944a8163a34b51258a4f0da92cfcd6f046fd1961
(cherry picked from commit 8b9b70845f27b86301a38736f502652bf4770394)
"}, {'created': '2018-09-19 19:35:14.000000000', 'message': "Clean up role tests

not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With

We do the following:

Change-Id: I944a8163a34b51258a4f0da92cfcd6f046fd1961
(cherry picked from commit 8b9b70845f27b86301a38736f502652bf4770394)
"}]
commit_message:
Clean up role tests

Now that we're using the general templates, we can slim down
the role test definitions. We can also remove tests which are
not being watched, or which are fundamentally broken. With
this we can also remove unused scripts/plays.

We do the following:

1. We remove the 'func_base' and 'func_log'. They are unused
   relics of the past.

Change-Id: I944a8163a34b51258a4f0da92cfcd6f046fd1961
(cherry picked from commit 8b9b70845f27b86301a38736f502652bf4770394)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia1cc88d2a6ae7f039f1d9de43969c81f7dfcfe27
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-20 09:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-09-20 13:08:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-09-20 13:08:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-09-20 13:43:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/rocky as commit e2d7fd6079bcbe0c3982c06d77f3f153851d7ccd'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-20 09:55:33.000000000', 'message': "Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7
"}]
commit_message:
Define cache_timeout variable

Much like the 'debug' variable, the 'cache_timeout' variable
is an expected variable, but is currently not defined in the
role. This causes the role to fail when the galera_client
meta-dep is removed (because that role defined it, this role
inherited it).

Change-Id: Ia788e5b83233e8f34377b024f98f7e463d85c1b7

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: I309022aa53b8878a167d09d6288678eee5ca0159
(cherry picked from commit d47e318bc14043912b2a3f817b0afc1ab0e62202)

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ida3b1bc70fbd6ab958d8669e925de1d3151f69ff
Story: #2002586
Task: #24342

commit_message:
Use ansible_host variable in wait_for task.

ansible_ssh_host and ansible_host variable behave differently
when used with delegate_to keyword.
ansible_ssh_host uses value from delegate_to, while
ansible_host stays intact.

Change-Id: I3c80da359cdd1051ed590ca7e282a22a15647033

subject: Follow the OpenStackClient options names format
messages:
[{'account_id': 22608, 'date': '2018-08-29 10:50:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28695, 'date': '2018-09-20 12:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Thank you for working on this.

In my opinion we should be more careful with this change since people are using Trove CLI out there and may be surprised if we suddenly reformat multiple options at once without warning.

To make things right we should follow a deprecation cycle, however, couldn't find any global guidance on this in OpenStack documentation except [1]. Deprecation changes introduced in Cinder [2] and Nova [3][4] clients may be treated as potential reference.

This is what I propose for current release as a bare minimum:

1. Keep both options with hyphens and with underscores (in places they occurred).
2. Add deprecation warning in help messages for each reformatted option, e.g.

 "--include_clustered will be deprecated in the future, retaining just --include-clustered"

3. List all deprecated options in release notes.

Besides, it would be appropriate to print warning when deprecated options is used. Don't have idea about how this could be implemented since argparse doesn't support deprecations natively. Found [3-5] as starting point.

In the subsequent release we will remove deprecated options.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-novaclient/latest/reference/deprecation-policy.html
[2] https://github.com/openstack/python-cinderclient/commit/a331f06df0158fff28162eabc765f164855afcee
[3] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/commit/3a762401245de8c2941ea41d6168c17ddd30aacd#diff-605f69d42c31b38095700b22171fbd6a
[4] https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/2e6ef0c45a6ada10440eb0ce87df74bf7070c1e4/novaclient/shell.py#L57
[5] https://github.com/openstack/osc-lib/blob/master/osc_lib/command/command.py#L50'}]

According to global OpenStack CLI guidelines [1], all long options names

commit_message:
Follow the OpenStackClient options names format

According to global OpenStack CLI guidelines [1], all long options names
begin with two dashes (--) and use a single dash (-) internally between
words (--like-this). Underscores (_) are not used in option names.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/python-openstackclient/latest/cli/commands.html

Change-Id: I70b42a1988b2f1110c9ad946246fe5b03c76080c
Signed-off-by: zhanggang <zhanggang@cmss.chinamobile.com>

commit_message:
Add bus for auto-loading charm modules.

charms_openstack.bus.discover() can now be used to load the openstack
charm modules placed under lib/charm/openstack/. This is particularly
useful when using the generic provide_charm_instance() code e.g.

```
charms_openstack.bus.discover()

with charms_openstack.charm.provide_charm_instance() as ci:
    ci.some_charm_instance_method()
```

Change-Id: Ic1dfb58a37b3f283bbc5b31b5ea192527fc8e57d

commit_message:
Disable OVN related services in ODL env file

ODL and OVN services are mutually exclusive and
leads to deployment failure when enabled on a role.
This patch sets OVN services to OS::Heat::None in
ODL env file to disable it whenever ODL is enabled.

Change-Id: Iaa757339f24fbadf51152326fe62f194c25e2384

Clean backport, and I wouldn't expect this to change, so +2 even though I haven't seen the zuul results yet."}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2018-08-30 15:19:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-19 04:51:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

remove these here.

To avoid this, you can move the jobs back to project-config.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-09-19 04:54:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

https://review.openstack.org/603554 is my proposal'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2018-09-20 11:52:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Andreas: Thanks for keeping an eye on our zuul usage!

I don't want to move these to project-config because then the glance team loses the ability to make quick changes.  The idea of the original change is that we'll do it in master and then won't have to worry about maintaining the .zuul.yaml when a stable branch is cut.  So while we could just remove the tips jobs from the periodic queue completely, as you do on your patch, I wanted to see this code merge so we can be sure that this change will work as expected when a stable branch is cut."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-23 15:00:59.000000000', 'message': 'Refactor periodic "tips" jobs

Two changes:
1 - declare the abstract base tips jobs 'abstract'
2 - add a branch matcher to where the periodic tips jobs
    are invoked in the project definition so that they only
    apply to the master branch

Change-Id: I1093de2583da862f58372e6c03b2d9b604dbd630
(cherry picked from commit 11db636c346c2a5ffcdc9a33633844939d116352)
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor periodic "tips" jobs

Two changes:
1 - declare the abstract base tips jobs 'abstract'
2 - add a branch matcher to where the periodic tips jobs
    are invoked in the project definition so that they only
    apply to the master branch

Change-Id: I1093de2583da862f58372e6c03b2d9b604dbd630
(cherry picked from commit 11db636c346c2a5ffcdc9a33633844939d116352)

commit_message:
Only set ca_bundle for HAProxy if internal TLS enabled & fix mounts

* We don't use this setup if TLS everywhere is not enabled, so lets set it
  up as such. This prevents the HAProxy container managed by pacemaker of
  mounting this file.
* Also fix the docker service to exercise the if with proper syntax.

Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Id8dff81c5af390446507bcef458a135fc2287186

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Add missing dep for SUSE distro installs

We add the 'python-cursive' package which is
required by cinder, and the service packages
have not yet got it as a dependency in the spec.

commit_message:

it fails with the following error

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I5c33fb6da777e0861b633b78f4ebcaa6971ddbb3
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

[{'created': '2018-08-15 12:53:16.000000000', 'message': 'Consolidate add/remove router interface OVS transactions

This patch consolidades the database transactions for creating/deleting
router ports on/from the OVN NB database. Having a single transaction is
ideal to avoid inconsistencies that can be cause between two or more
transactions.

Closes-Bug: #1756388

commit_message:
Consolidate add/remove router interface OVS transactions

This patch consolidades the database transactions for creating/deleting
router ports on/from the OVN NB database. Having a single transaction is
ideal to avoid inconsistencies that can be cause between two or more
transactions.

Closes-Bug: #1756388
Change-Id: I0a0a5f6571ea695b91db89170be1fab258acd917
(cherry picked from commit 378f4ec58e16a363aeabd16da1911775d0b36487)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-17 19:54:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add ha-guide to redirect ignore list

The openstack/ha-guide repo is being restored and maintained by the
Operations Documentation SIG. At least for now, this information will
not be cycle based and should not be redirected from its base URL to
/latest. This adds the repo to the list to be ignored for .htaccess
redirects.

Change-Id: I6ffb504c819c8087566763b1abef24b9db5237ed
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add ha-guide to redirect ignore list

The openstack/ha-guide repo is being restored and maintained by the
Operations Documentation SIG. At least for now, this information will
not be cycle based and should not be redirected from its base URL to
/latest. This adds the repo to the list to be ignored for .htaccess
redirects.

Change-Id: I6ffb504c819c8087566763b1abef24b9db5237ed
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

GATE CHECK for TripleO

This change is used to check the health of our stable branch gate jobs
in the most direct way possible, by running the real gates on a noop
change.

Change-Id: If12c8fe9bd0bea98a4842f279399285344f22246

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding

commit_message:
Remove galera_client meta-dependency

Given that pymysql is pure python and has no C binding
dependencies, we no longer need the role to install the
MariaDB client libraries.

Change-Id: Ibecc182d370d1aa3801f49d47421d9fd2037df5f
(cherry picked from commit 9f4de30f2055ff5ae07513670c5ea7a1308794ad)

commit_message:
Run cell v2 setup differently for upgrades

For the upgrades from Newton, we need to run the cell v2 simple setup
before running the api db sync since we did not deploy cell v2 in
Newton. Starting with Ocata, api db sync errors if the cell v2 simple
setup has not been done.

Change-Id: I80ecc0943e08952fbc29c55da9d4ba8f51b0eb7e
Closes-Bug: #1649341

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 27911, 'date': '2018-09-20 09:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

(4 comments)

I am hesitate to rename those methods name as they are not so bad currently. Doc string clear the exact operation and name of these methods are as per APIs. 

There are no APIs which does the same operation for all the extra specs so current methods are ok as it is. 

It is costly to rename the lib interfaces and we should avoid that till it is very much required.'}, {'account_id': 23081, 'date': '2018-06-21 12:24:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Yes, I agree with you, thanks.'}, {'account_id': 23081, 'date': '2018-09-20 09:30:03.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-31 10:50:44.000000000', 'message': "Rename volume type extra specs APIs

The name of APIs below in volume v2 types client don't describe their
actual functions clearly or fullly. This patch deprecates the original
name of these APIs and renames them to the new ones.

1. show_volume_type_extra_specs -> show_volume_type_extra_specs_item
2. create_volume_type_extra_specs ->
create_or_update_volume_type_extra_specs
3. delete_volume_type_extra_specs -> delete_volume_type_extra_specs_item
4. update_volume_type_extra_specs -> update_volume_type_extra_specs_item

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: I4e93d3c71ce4030960ac470d94fc5f4c6bef0eed
"}, {'created': '2017-11-01 01:24:27.000000000', 'message': "Rename volume type extra specs APIs

create_or_update_volume_type_extra_specs
3. delete_volume_type_extra_specs -> delete_volume_type_extra_specs_item

commit_message:
Rename volume type extra specs APIs

The name of APIs below in volume v3 types client don't describe their
actual functions clearly or fully. This patch deprecates the original
names of these APIs and renames them to the new ones.

1. show_volume_type_extra_specs -> show_volume_type_extra_specs_item
2. create_volume_type_extra_specs -> create_or_update_volume_type_extra_specs
3. delete_volume_type_extra_specs -> delete_volume_type_extra_specs_item
4. update_volume_type_extra_specs -> update_volume_type_extra_specs_item

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names
Change-Id: I4e93d3c71ce4030960ac470d94fc5f4c6bef0eed

commit_message:
Use alembic migrations to bootstrap Monasca database

Alembic uses the monasca-agent config file for the DB
credentials. These are therefore no longer required.

Partially-Implements: blueprint monasca-roles
Change-Id: Id076e7a0b838888314159dd9e76697f89adecb5e

commit_message:
Add method to wrap HashiCorp Vault HTTP API calls.

The new method handles the HTTP request for the Vault HTTP API
and does the error checking in a single place. The same code
was already in four different places in the same file.

Change-Id: I4b688d8cf994fb26f88570840523fcc0ac24faba
Signed-off-by: Moises Guimaraes de Medeiros <moguimar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: Ia4a56b77fa526d46d521517ee4e13ce12dae6f4d
Story: #2002586
Task: #24319

Add different configs depending upon the Linux distribution.

commit_message:
libvirt: Drop MIN_LIBVIRT_VHOSTUSER_MQ

The updated minimum required libvirt (1.3.1) and QEMU (2.5.0) for
"Rocky" matches this now, so we can drop the compatibility code.

Also remove / fix relevant unit tests.

Change-Id: I92d59d10de4df1776b5b80f9f7db8be9331e4b1f

commit_message:
Clean up unused VNF status

Currently, "DOWN" and "INACTIVE" are defined as VNF status, but these
status is no need to be used anymore. So this patch aim to remove
these status from Tacker code.

Change-Id: I98a4f24b8ddb4de5bd799de243cf728cac99e615

[{'created': '2018-09-20 07:00:43.000000000', 'message': 'Backout actions.yaml as a tactical fix.

The current implementation forces a charm to define its own
pause/resume actions and charm lint will fail if they do not. This
breaks charms in an unpleasant way so instead work is ongoing
to make pause/resume code standalone in this layer. For the moment
backout actions to unbreak charms.

Change-Id: I04f313097f632d7fa89e1734b966d12bda21656c
'}]
commit_message:
Backout actions.yaml as a tactical fix.

The current implementation forces a charm to define its own
pause/resume actions and charm lint will fail if they do not. This
breaks charms in an unpleasant way so instead work is ongoing
to make pause/resume code standalone in this layer. For the moment
backout actions to unbreak charms.

Change-Id: I04f313097f632d7fa89e1734b966d12bda21656c

commit_message:
Pin fog-openstack to < 0.3.0

With 0.3.1, fog-openstack renames much of its API, resulting in
errors such as:

  openstack_domain[default] (openstack-identity::registration line 69) had
  an error: NameError: uninitialized constant Fog::Identity::OpenStack

Let's stay below 0.3 for now.

Change-Id: Id3e9e6d8560ef5ffd9d28eedc0a2494722a2878f
(cherry picked from commit 0664bf29358ce16d85756d994751b4a3a37a6118)

subject: Fix port_range_max attribute definition
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 4694, 'name': 'Miguel Lavalle', 'email': 'miguel@mlavalle.com', 'username': 'minsel'}, {'_account_id': 11975, 'name': 'Slawek Kaplonski', 'email': 'skaplons@redhat.com', 'username': 'slaweq'}, {'_account_id': 13995, 'name': 'Nate Johnston', 'email': 'nate.johnston@redhat.com', 'username': 'natejohnston'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28474, 'name': 'Miguel Duarte Barroso', 'email': 'mdbarroso@redhat.com', 'username': 'mbarroso'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-09-19 13:25:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28474, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the prompt action.'}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:14:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I believe that "type" is the correct terminology per RFC:

   ICMP messages are sent using the basic IP header.  The first octet of
   the data portion of the datagram is a ICMP type field; the value of
   this field determines the format of the remaining data.

http://www.faqs.org/rfcs/rfc792.html'}, {'account_id': 28474, 'date': '2018-09-19 14:19:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hm, yes, type would be the first octect - which corresponds to the 'port_range_min' attribute - whereas code is the second octect - which would correspond to 'port_range_max'. 

Am I missing something?"}, {'account_id': 13995, 'date': '2018-09-19 15:44:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Ah, forgive me, I was misaligned in my mapping.  Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-09-19 16:41:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4694, 'date': '2018-09-19 16:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Nice catch, I might add!'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-09-19 17:33:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

You'll have to credit your tocayo, it wasn't me - bet you never thought I'd be able to use that within a week of learning it :)"}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-09-20 07:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-19 13:25:37.000000000', 'message': 'Fix port_range_max attribute definition

port_range_max in an ICMP security group rule defines the
ICMP code value, fix a copy/paste typo.

Change-Id: I4356610d106385c72afc9c3fb7b194c690c56cae
Closes-bug: #1793285
'}]
commit_message:
Fix port_range_max attribute definition

port_range_max in an ICMP security group rule defines the
ICMP code value, fix a copy/paste typo.

Change-Id: I4356610d106385c72afc9c3fb7b194c690c56cae
Closes-bug: #1793285

Commit #1
=========

Get ceilometer from pypi

=========

Fix PEP8 tox environment

It has checks for documentation however it was missing the documentation
requirements.

Change-Id: I9c604e0180b62ecb9e26eedb510a69fbc1f51d03

commit_message:
Fix stable/rocky CI

This is a combination of 2 commits.

Commit #1
=========

Get ceilometer from pypi

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/603288/
(cherry picked from commit c2b386c1dd49f8e300d6ad8aa8a6f0cec897ecd7)

Commit #2
=========

Fix PEP8 tox environment

It has checks for documentation however it was missing the documentation
requirements.

This patch adds doc/requirements.txt as a source for pip packages.

(cherry picked from commit 79a6cb667235490e42f0d0ba25b472b07d94b3af)

Change-Id: I9c604e0180b62ecb9e26eedb510a69fbc1f51d03

commit_message:
import zuul job settings from project-config

This is a mechanically generated patch to complete step 1 of moving
the zuul job settings out of project-config and into each project
repository.

Because there will be a separate patch on each branch, the branch
specifiers for branch-specific jobs have been removed.

Because this patch is generated by a script, there may be some
cosmetic changes to the layout of the YAML file(s) as the contents are
normalized.

See the python3-first goal document for details:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/stein/python3-first.html

Change-Id: I824142c7797b490fa29dcae4b4e97e374d109ed5
Story: #2002586
Task: #24312

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-26 18:50:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix delorean-deps url for releases >= rocky

Since Rocky, RDO has split dependencies repo in two different
repos, one for runtime requirement with the URL used in previous
releases and a new one with the packages that are only required
to build packages.
This patch fixes repos to the correct set for rocky and master
in the releases file which have these wrongly set.

Change-Id: I94621e899c1e854d8a762cb05b495b8fd9178ef7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix delorean-deps url for releases >= rocky

Since Rocky, RDO has split dependencies repo in two different
repos, one for runtime requirement with the URL used in previous
releases and a new one with the packages that are only required
to build packages.
This patch fixes repos to the correct set for rocky and master
in the releases file which have these wrongly set.

Change-Id: I94621e899c1e854d8a762cb05b495b8fd9178ef7
